<BR>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE=4 FACE="ARIAL-BOLDMT,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	INDEPENDENT AUDITORS&#146; REPORT OF REGISTERED PUBLIC
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE=4 FACE="ARIAL-BOLDMT,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	ACCOUNTING FIRM
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="ARIALMT,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	To the Shareholders and Directors of Tanzanian Royalty Exploration Corporation
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="ARIALMT,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	We have audited the accompanying consolidated financial statements of Tanzanian Royalty Exploration Corporation, which comprise the consolidated statement of financial position as at August 31, 2012, the consolidated statements of comprehensive loss, changes in equity and cash flow for the year ended August 31, 2012, and notes, comprising a summary of significant accounting policies and other explanatory information.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<I>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="ARIAL-ITALICMT,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	Management's Responsibility for the Consolidated Financial Statements
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="ARIALMT,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	Management is responsible for the preparation and fair presentation of these consolidated financial statements in accordance with International Financial Reporting Standards as issued by the International Accounting Standards Board, and for such internal control as management determines is necessary to enable the preparation of consolidated financial statements that are free from material misstatement, whether due to fraud or error.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<I>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="ARIAL-ITALICMT,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	Auditors&#146; Responsibility
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="ARIALMT,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	Our responsibility is to express an opinion on these consolidated financial statements based on our audit. We conducted our audit in accordance with Canadian generally accepted auditing standards and the standards of the Public Company Accounting Oversight Board (United States). Those standards require that we comply with ethical requirements and plan and perform the audit to obtain reasonable assurance about whether the consolidated financial statements are free from material misstatement.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="ARIALMT,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	An audit involves performing procedures to obtain audit evidence about the amounts and disclosures in the consolidated financial statements. The procedures selected depend on our judgment, including the assessment of the risks of material misstatement of the consolidated financial statements, whether due to fraud or error. In making those risk assessments, we consider internal control relevant to the entity's preparation and fair presentation of the consolidated financial statements in order to design audit procedures that are appropriate in the circumstances. An audit also includes evaluating the appropriateness of accounting policies used and the reasonableness of accounting estimates made by management, as well as evaluating the overall presentation of the consolidated financial statements.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="ARIALMT,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	We believe that the audit evidence we have obtained is sufficient and appropriate to provide a basis for our audit opinion.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT SIZE=1 FACE="UNIVERS-45LIGHT,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	KPMG LLP is a Canadian limited liability partnership and a member firm of the KPMG
</FONT>
<BR>
<FONT SIZE=1 FACE="UNIVERS-45LIGHT,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	network of independent member firms affiliated with KPMG International Cooperative
</FONT>
<BR>
<FONT SIZE=1 FACE="UNIVERS-45LIGHT,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	(&#147;KPMG International&#148;), a Swiss entity.
</FONT>
<BR>
<FONT SIZE=1 FACE="UNIVERS-45LIGHT,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	KPMG Canada provides services to KPMG LLP.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
</P>

<BR>
<P ALIGN="RIGHT">
<I>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="ARIAL-ITALICMT,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	Tanzanian Royalty Exploration Corporation
</FONT>
</I>
<BR>
<I>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="ARIAL-ITALICMT,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	Page 2
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<I>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="ARIAL-ITALICMT,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	Opinion
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="ARIALMT,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	In our opinion, the consolidated financial statements present fairly, in all material respects, the consolidated financial position of Tanzanian Royalty Exploration Corporation as at August 31, 2012, and its consolidated financial performance and its consolidated cash flows for the year ended August 31, 2012, in accordance with International Financial Reporting Standards
</FONT>
<FONT COLOR="#221E1F" SIZE=2 FACE="ARIALMT,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	as issued by the International Accounting Standards Board.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">

<A NAME="FINS_HTM_PAGE_7">
</A>
<BR>
<A NAME="FINS_HTM__BCLPAGEBORDER7">
</A>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; PADDING-RIGHT: 0%; PADDING-LEFT: 0%">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA-BOLD,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	MANAGEMENT&#146;S REPORT ON INTERNAL CONTROL OVER FINANCIAL REPORTING
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	Management of the Company is responsible for establishing and maintaining adequate internal control over financial reporting for the Company as defined in Rule 13a-15(f) under the Securities and Exchange Act of 1934. Management of the Company is responsible for establishing and maintaining adequate internal control over financial reporting for the Company. The Company&#146;s management, including our Chief Executive Officer and Chief Financial Officer, conducted an evaluation of the effectiveness of our internal control over financial reporting as of August 31, 2013. In making this assessment, the Company&#146;s management used the criteria established in Internal Control &#150; Integrated Framework, issued by the Committee of Sponsoring Organizations of the Treadway Commission (&#147;COSO&#148;). The Company&#146;s management has completed their review and testing of the Company&#146;s internal control over financial reporting and concluded that they are appropriately designed and operating effectively as of August 31, 2013.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	7
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<HR NOSHADE ALIGN="CENTER" WIDTH="100%" SIZE=2>
<A NAME="eolPage153"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<!--$$/PAGE=-->
<A NAME="FINS_HTM_PAGE_8">
</A>
<BR>
<A NAME="FINS_HTM__BCLPAGEBORDER8">
</A>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; PADDING-RIGHT: 0%; PADDING-LEFT: 0%">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<B>
<FONT SIZE=4 FACE="TIMESNEWROMANPS-BOLDMT,TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF">
	INDEPENDENT AUDITORS&#146; REPORT
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<B>
<FONT SIZE=4 FACE="TIMESNEWROMANPS-BOLDMT,TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF">
	OF REGISTERED PUBLIC ACCOUNTING FIRM
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=3 FACE="TIMESNEWROMANPSMT,TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT: SMALL TIMESNEWROMANPSMT,TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF">
	To the Board of Directors and Shareholders of
</FONT>
<BR>
<B>
<FONT SIZE=3 FACE="TIMESNEWROMANPS-BOLDMT,TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF">
	Tanzanian Royalty Exploration Corporation
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=3 FACE="TIMESNEWROMANPSMT,TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF">
	We have audited
</FONT>
<B>
<FONT SIZE=3 FACE="TIMESNEWROMANPS-BOLDMT,TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF">
	Tanzanian Royalty Exploration Corporation
</FONT>
</B>
<FONT SIZE=3 FACE="TIMESNEWROMANPSMT,TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF">
	&#146;s internal control over financial reporting as of August 31, 2013, based on criteria established in Internal Control &#151; Integrated Framework issued by the Committee of Sponsoring Organizations of the Treadway Commission (1992 framework) (the COSO criteria).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE=3 FACE="TIMESNEWROMANPS-BOLDMT,TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF">
	Tanzanian Royalty Exploration Corporation
</FONT>
</B>
<FONT SIZE=3 FACE="TIMESNEWROMANPSMT,TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF">
	&#146;s management is responsible for maintaining effective internal control over financial reporting, and for its assessment of the effectiveness of internal control over financial reporting included in the accompanying &#147;Management&#146;s Report on Internal Control Over Financial Reporting&#148;. Our responsibility is to express an opinion on the company&#146;s internal control over financial reporting based on our audit.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=3 FACE="TIMESNEWROMANPSMT,TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF">
	We conducted our audit in accordance with the standards of the Public Company Accounting Oversight Board (United States). Those standards require that we plan and perform the audit to obtain reasonable assurance about whether effective internal control over financial reporting was maintained in all material respects. Our audit included obtaining an understanding of internal control over financial reporting, assessing the risk that a material weakness exists, testing and evaluating the design and operating effectiveness of internal control based on the assessed risk, and performing such other procedures as we considered necessary in the circumstances. We believe that our audit provides a reasonable basis for our opinion.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=3 FACE="TIMESNEWROMANPSMT,TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF">
	A company&#146;s internal control over financial reporting is a process designed to provide reasonable assurance regarding the reliability of financial reporting and the preparation of financial statements for external purposes in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles. A company&#146;s internal control over financial reporting includes those policies and procedures that (1) pertain to the maintenance of records that, in reasonable detail, accurately and fairly reflect the transactions and dispositions of the assets of the company; (2) provide reasonable assurance that transactions are recorded as necessary to permit preparation of financial statements in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles, and that receipts and expenditures of the company are being made only in accordance with authorizations of management and directors of the company; and (3) provide reasonable assurance regarding prevention or timely detection of unauthorized acquisition, use, or disposition of the company&#146;s assets that could have a material effect on the financial statements.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">
<IMG SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2013/11/15/0001137171-13-000367_FINSX8X1.JPG" BORDER=0>
</P>
</DIV>
<HR NOSHADE ALIGN="CENTER" WIDTH="100%" SIZE=2>
<A NAME="eolPage154"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<!--$$/PAGE=-->
<A NAME="FINS_HTM_PAGE_9">
</A>
<BR>
<A NAME="FINS_HTM__BCLPAGEBORDER9">
</A>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=3 FACE="TIMESNEWROMANPSMT,TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF">
	Because of its inherent limitations, internal control over financial reporting may not prevent or detect misstatements. Also, projections of any evaluation of effectiveness to future periods are subject to the risk that controls may become inadequate because of changes in conditions, or that the degree of compliance with the policies or procedures may deteriorate.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=3 FACE="TIMESNEWROMANPSMT,TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF">
	In our opinion,
</FONT>
<B>
<FONT SIZE=3 FACE="TIMESNEWROMANPS-BOLDMT,TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF">
	Tanzanian Royalty Exploration Corporation
</FONT>
</B>
<FONT SIZE=3 FACE="TIMESNEWROMANPSMT,TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF">
	maintained, in all material respects, effective internal control over financial reporting as of August 31, 2013, based on the COSO criteria.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=3 FACE="TIMESNEWROMANPSMT,TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF">
	We also have audited, in accordance with the standards of the Public Company Accounting Oversight Board (United States), the consolidated statement of financial position of
</FONT>
<B>
<FONT SIZE=3 FACE="TIMESNEWROMANPS-BOLDMT,TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF">
	Tanzanian Royalty Exploration Corporation
</FONT>
</B>
<FONT SIZE=3 FACE="TIMESNEWROMANPSMT,TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF">
	as at August 31, 2013 and the related consolidated statements of comprehensive loss, changes in equity, and cash flow for the year then ended and our report dated November 8, 2013 expressed an unqualified opinion thereon.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT: SMALL TIMESNEWROMANPSMT,TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>

<IMG SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2013/11/15/0001137171-13-000367_SIGNATURE.JPG" ALT="" WIDTH="251" HEIGHT="50">
<FONT STYLE="FONT: SMALL TIMESNEWROMANPSMT,TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>

	&nbsp;

<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; PADDING-RIGHT: 0%; PADDING-LEFT: 0%">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<B>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA-BOLD,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	Tanzanian Royalty Exploration Corporation
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<B>
<FONT STYLE="FONT: X-SMALL HELVETICA-BOLD,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	Notes to the Consolidated Financial Statements
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<B>
<FONT STYLE="FONT: X-SMALL HELVETICA-BOLD,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	For the Years Ended August 31, 2013 and 2012
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA-BOLD,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<B>
<FONT STYLE="FONT: X-SMALL HELVETICA-BOLD,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	1. Nature of Operations
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	The Company is in the process of exploring and evaluating its mineral properties. The business of exploring and mining for minerals involves a high degree of risk. The underlying value of the mineral properties is dependent upon the existence and economic recovery of mineral reserves, the ability to raise long-term financing to complete the development of the properties, government policies and regulations, and upon future profitable production or, alternatively, upon the Company&#146;s ability to dispose of its interest on an advantageous basis; all of which are uncertain.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	The amounts shown as mineral properties and deferred expenditures represent costs incurred to date, less amounts amortized and/or written off, and do not necessarily represent present or future values. The underlying value of the mineral properties is entirely dependent on the existence of economically recoverable reserves, securing and maintaining title and beneficial interest, the ability of the Company to obtain the necessary financing to complete development, and future profitable production.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	At August 31, 2013 the Company had working capital of &#36;5,416,104 (August 31, 2012 &#150; &#36;18,165,431), including warrant liability or a working capital of &#36;8,940,104 (August 31, 2012 &#150; &#36;18,165,431) excluding warrant liability, had not yet achieved profitable operations, has accumulated losses of &#36;67,117,263 (August 31, 2012 &#150; &#36;64,098,273) and expects to incur further losses in the development of its business. In the long term, the Company will require additional financing in order to conduct its planned work programs on mineral properties, meet its ongoing levels of corporate overhead and discharge its future liabilities as they come due.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA-BOLD,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	2. Basis of Preparation
</FONT>
</B>
<B>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA-BOLD,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<B>
<FONT STYLE="FONT: X-SMALL HELVETICA-BOLD,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	2.1 Statement of compliance
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	The Company was originally incorporated under the corporate name &#147;
</FONT>
<I>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA-OBLIQUE,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	424547 Alberta Ltd
</FONT>
</I>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	.&#148; in the Province of Alberta on July 5, 1990, under the
</FONT>
<I>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA-OBLIQUE,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	Business Corporations Act
</FONT>
</I>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	(Alberta). The name was changed to &#147;
</FONT>
<I>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA-OBLIQUE,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	Tan Range Exploration Corporation
</FONT>
</I>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	&#148; on August 13, 1991. The name of the Company was again changed to
</FONT>
<I>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA-OBLIQUE,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	&#147;Tanzanian Royalty Exploration Corporation&#148; (&#147;TREC&#148; or the &#147;Company&#148;)
</FONT>
</I>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	on February 28, 2006. The address of the Company&#146;s registered office is 400 3rd Avenue SW, Suite 3700, Calgary, Alberta T2P 4H2 Canada. The Company&#146;s principal business activity is in the exploration and development of mineral property interests. The Company&#146;s mineral properties are located in United Republic of Tanzania. The consolidated financial statements of the Company as at and for the years ended August 31, 2013 and 2012 comprise of the Company and its subsidiaries (together referred to as the &#147;Company&#148; or &#147;Group&#148;).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	The Company&#146;s consolidated financial statements, including comparatives, have been prepared in accordance with and using accounting policies in full compliance with the International Financial Reporting Standards (&#147;IFRS&#148;) and International Accounting Standards (&#147;IAS&#148;) issued by the International Accounting Standards Board (&#147;IASB&#148;) and Interpretations of the International Financial Reporting Interpretations Committee (&#147;IFRIC&#148;), effective for the Company&#146;s reporting for the year ended August 31, 2013.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	These consolidated financial statements were approved and authorized by the Board of Directors of the Company on November 8, 2013.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA-BOLD,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	2.2 Basis of presentation
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	The consolidated financial statements have been prepared on the historical cost basis except for certain financial instruments, which are measured at fair value, as explained in the accounting policies set out in note 3.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	15
</FONT>
</P>

<TD WIDTH="96%">
<B>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA-BOLD,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	Adoption of new and revised standards and interpretations
</FONT>
</B>
</TD>
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="10%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT: NORMAL 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	The IASB issued a number
	of new and revised International Accounting Standards, International Financial Reporting Standards, amendments and related interpretations
	which are effective for the Company&rsquo;s financial year beginning on or after September 1, 2012. For the purpose of preparing and
	presenting the Financial Information for the relevant periods, the Company has consistently adopted all
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	new standards for the relevant reporting
	periods.
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="90%">
<BLOCKQUOTE>
	&nbsp;
</BLOCKQUOTE>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<P>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	At the date of authorization of these financial statements, the IASB and IFRIC has issued the following
	new and revised Standards and Interpretations which are not yet effective for the relevant reporting periods.
</FONT>
</P>
<TABLE>
<TD WIDTH="96%">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	IFRS 7 &#145;
</FONT>
<I>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA-OBLIQUE,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	Financial Instruments, Disclosures
</FONT>
</I>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	&#146; - effective for annual periods beginning on or after January 1, 2013, IFRS 7 has been amended to provide more extensive quantitative disclosures for financial instruments that are offset in the statement of financial position or that are subject to enforceable master netting similar arrangements.
</FONT>
</TD>
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="2%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TABLE>
<TABLE>
<TD WIDTH="96%">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	IFRS 9
</FONT>
<I>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA-OBLIQUE,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	&#145;Financial Instruments: Classification and Measurement&#146; &#150;
</FONT>
</I>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	effective for annual periods beginning on or after January 1, 2015, with early adoption permitted, introduces new requirements for the classification and measurement of financial instruments.
</FONT>
</TD>
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="2%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TABLE>
<TABLE>
<TD WIDTH="96%">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	IFRS 10 &#145;
</FONT>
<I>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA-OBLIQUE,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	Consolidated Financial Statements&#146; &#150;
</FONT>
</I>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	effective for annual periods beginning on or after January 1, 2013, with early adoption permitted, establishes principles for the presentation and preparation of consolidated financial statements when an entity controls one or more other entities.
</FONT>
</TD>
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="2%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD NOWRAP WIDTH="2%" STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
</TABLE>
<TABLE>
<TD WIDTH="96%">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	IFRS 11 &#145;
</FONT>
<I>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA-OBLIQUE,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	Joint Arrangements&#146; -
</FONT>
</I>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	effective for annual periods beginning on or after January 1, 2013, with early adoption permitted, provides for a more realistic reflection of joint arrangements by focusing on the rights and obligations of the arrangement, rather than its legal form.
</FONT>
</TD>
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="2%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD NOWRAP WIDTH="2%" STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
</TABLE>
<TABLE>
<TD WIDTH="96%">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	IFRS 12 &#145;
</FONT>
<I>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA-OBLIQUE,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	Disclosure of Interests in Other Entities&#146; -
</FONT>
</I>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	effective for annual periods beginning on or after January 1, 2013, with early adoption permitted, requires the disclosure of information that enables users of financial statements to evaluate the nature of, and risks associated with its interests in other entities and the effects of those interests on its financial position, financial performance and cash flows.
</FONT>
</TD>
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="2%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD NOWRAP WIDTH="2%" STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
</TABLE>
<TABLE>
<TD WIDTH="96%">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	IFRS 13 &#145;
</FONT>
<I>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA-OBLIQUE,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	Fair Value Measurement&#146; -
</FONT>
</I>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	effective for annual periods beginning on or after January 1, 2013, with early adoption permitted, provides the guidance on the measurement of fair value and related disclosures through a fair value hierarchy.
</FONT>
</TD>
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="2%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD NOWRAP WIDTH="2%" STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
</TABLE>
<TABLE>
<TD WIDTH="96%">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	IAS 27 &#145;
</FONT>
<I>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA-OBLIQUE,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	Separate Financial Statements
</FONT>
</I>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	&#146; - effective for annual periods beginning on or after January 1, 2013, as a result of the issue of the new consolidation suite of standards, IAS 27 Separate Financial Statements has been reissued, as the consolidation guidance will now be included in IFRS
</FONT>
</TD>
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="10%">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	10. IAS 27 will now only prescribe the accounting and disclosure requirements for investments in subsidiaries, joint ventures and associates when an entity prepares separate financial statements.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="2%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TABLE>
<TABLE>
<TD WIDTH="96%">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	IAS 28 &#145;
</FONT>
<I>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA-OBLIQUE,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	Investments in Associates and Joint Ventures&#146;
</FONT>
</I>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	- effective for annual periods beginning on or after January 1, 2013, as a consequence of the issue of IFRS 10, IFRS 11 and IFRS 12, IAS 28 has been amended and will provide the accounting guidance for investments in associates and to set out
	requirements for the application of the equity method when accounting for investments in
	and joint ventures. The amended IAS 28 will be applied by all entities that are investors
	joint control of, or significant influence over, an investee.
</FONT>
</TD>
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="2%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TABLE>

<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<B>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA-BOLD,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	Tanzanian Royalty Exploration Corporation
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<B>
<FONT STYLE="FONT: X-SMALL HELVETICA-BOLD,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	Notes to the Consolidated Financial Statements
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<B>
<FONT STYLE="FONT: X-SMALL HELVETICA-BOLD,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	For the Years Ended August 31, 2013 and 2012
</FONT>
</B>
</P>

<B>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA-BOLD,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	2.
</FONT>
</B>
	&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="98%">
<B>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA-BOLD,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	Basis of Preparation (continued)
</FONT>
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	IAS 32 &lsquo;
</FONT>
<I>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA-OBLIQUE,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	Financial
	instruments, Presentation&rsquo; -
</FONT>
</I>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	In December 2011, effective for annual periods beginning on or after January 1,
	2013, IAS 32 was amended to clarify the requirements for offsetting financial
	assets and liabilities. The amendments clarify that the right of offset must be
	available on the current date and cannot be contingent on a future date.
</FONT>
</P>
<TABLE BORDER=0 CELLSPACING=0>
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="2%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="RIGHT" WIDTH="2%" STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	2.3
</LI>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="96%">
<B>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA-BOLD,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	Adoption of new and revised standards and interpretations (continued)
</FONT>
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	Management
	anticipates that where required, the above standards will be adopted at the
	applicable effective dates in the Company's financial statements, and is in
	the process of considering the impact of adoption of these standards.
</FONT>
</P>
<TABLE>
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="98%" COLSPAN=2>
<B>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA-BOLD,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	3.
</FONT>
</B>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA-BOLD,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
<B>
	Summary of
	Significant Accounting Policies
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="RIGHT" WIDTH="2%" STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	3.1
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="96%">
<B>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA-BOLD,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	Basis of consolidation
</FONT>
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	The consolidated
	financial statements include the financial statements of the Company and its
	wholly controlled subsidiaries: Tanzania American International Development
	Corporation 2000 Limited ("Tanzam"), Tancan Mining Co. Limited ("Tancan"),
	Buckreef Gold Company Ltd. ("Buckreef"), and Northwestern Base Metals
	Company Limited ("NWBM"). Control is achieved when the Company has
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	power to govern the financial and
	operating policies of an entity so as to obtain benefits from its activities.
</FONT>
</P>
<P>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	Subsidiaries are consolidated from the date of acquisition, being the date on which the Company obtains control, and continued to be consolidated until the date when such control ceases. The financial statements of the subsidiaries are prepared for the same reporting period as the parent company, using consistent accounting policies.
</FONT>
</P>
<P>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	The consolidated financial statements of the Company set out the assets, liabilities, expenses, and cash flows of the Corporation and its subsidiaries, namely:
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT: X-SMALL HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	All intra-company transactions, balances,
	income and expenses are eliminated in full on consolidation.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	Non
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="TT2F4T00,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	controlling interests in the net assets of consolidated subsidiaries are identified separately from the Company&#146;s equity therein. Total comprehensive income within a subsidiary is attributed to the non-controlling interest even if it results in a negative balance.
</FONT>
</P>
<P>
	&nbsp;
</P>

<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	17
</FONT>
</P>

<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; PADDING-RIGHT: 0%; PADDING-LEFT: 0%">
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; PADDING-RIGHT: 0%; PADDING-LEFT: 0%">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="HELVETICA-BOLD,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	Tanzanian Royalty Exploration Corporation
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<B>
<FONT STYLE="FONT: X-SMALL HELVETICA-BOLD,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	Notes to the Consolidated Financial Statements
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<B>
<FONT STYLE="FONT: X-SMALL HELVETICA-BOLD,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	For the Years Ended August 31, 2013 and 2012
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA-BOLD,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	3. Summary of Significant Accounting Policies
	(continued) 3.2 Mineral properties
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	All direct costs related to the acquisition and exploration and development of specific properties are capitalized as incurred. If a property is brought into production, these costs will be amortized against the income generated from the property. If a property is abandoned, sold or impaired, an appropriate charge will be made to the statement of comprehensive loss at the date of such impairment. Discretionary option payments arising on the acquisition of mining properties are only recognized when paid. Amounts received from other parties to earn an interest in the Company's mining properties are applied as a reduction of the mining property and deferred exploration and development costs until all capitalized costs are recovered at which time additional reimbursements are recorded in the statement of comprehensive loss, except for administrative reimbursements which are credited to operations.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	Consequential revenue from the sale of metals, extracted during the Company's test mining activities, is recognized on the date the mineral concentrate level is agreed upon by the Company and customer, as this coincides with the transfer of title, the risk of ownership, the determination of the amount due under the terms of settlement contracts the Company has with its customer, and collection is reasonably assured. Revenues from properties earned prior to the commercial production stage are deducted from capitalized costs.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	The amounts shown for mining claims and related deferred costs represent costs incurred to date, less amounts expensed or written off, reimbursements and revenue, and do not necessarily reflect present or future values of the particular properties. The recoverability of these costs is dependent upon discovery of economically recoverable reserves and future production or proceeds from the disposition thereof.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	The Company reviews the carrying value of a mineral exploration property when events or changes in circumstances indicate that the carrying value may not be recoverable. If the carrying value of the property exceeds its fair value, the property will be written down to fair value with the provision charged against operations in the year of impairment. An impairment is also recorded when management determines that it will discontinue exploration or development on a property or when exploration rights or permits expire.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	Ownership in mineral properties involves certain risks due to the difficulties in determining the validity of certain claims as well as the potential for problems arising from the frequently ambiguous conveyance history characteristic of many mineral interests. The Company has investigated the ownership of its mineral properties and, to the best of its knowledge, ownership of its interests are in good standing.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	Capitalized mineral property exploration costs are those directly attributable costs related to the search for, and evaluation of mineral resources that are incurred after the Company has obtained legal rights to explore a mineral property and before the technical feasibility and commercial viability of a mineral reserve are demonstrable. Any cost incurred prior to obtaining the legal right to explore a mineral property are expensed as incurred. Field overhead costs directly related to exploration are capitalized and allocated to mineral properties explored. All other overhead and administration costs are expensed as incurred.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	Once an economically viable reserve has been determined for a property and a decision has been made to proceed with development has been approved, acquisition, exploration and development costs previously capitalized to the mineral property are first tested for impairment and then classified as property, plant and equipment under construction.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	18
</FONT>
</P>

	&nbsp;

<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA-BOLD,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	3. Summary of Significant Accounting Policies
	(continued)
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA-BOLD,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	3.3 Property, plant and equipment
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	Property, plant and equipment (&#147;PPE&#148;) are stated at cost less accumulated depreciation and accumulated impairment losses. The cost of an item of PPE consists of the purchase price, any costs directly attributable to bringing the asset to the location and condition necessary for its intended use and an initial estimate of the costs of dismantling and removing the item and restoring the site on which it is located.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	Depreciation is provided at rates calculated to write off the cost of
	PPE, less their estimated residual value, using the declining balance method over the following expected useful
	lives:
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_49"></A>
<TABLE BORDER="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%">

</TD>

</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 3%">
</TD>
</TR>

<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	Drilling equipment and automotive equipment
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN=RIGHT>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	6.67
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN=LEFT>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	%
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<TD ALIGN=LEFT STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	Leasehold improvements
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN=RIGHT STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	20
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN=LEFT STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	%
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P>
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	An item of PPE is
	derecognized upon disposal, when held for sale or when no future economic
	benefits are expected to arise from the continued use of the asset. Any gain or
	loss arising on disposal of the asset, determined as the difference between the
	net disposal proceeds and the carrying amount of the asset, is recognized in the
	consolidated statement of comprehensive loss.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	The Company conducts an
	annual assessment of the residual balances, useful lives and depreciation
	methods being used for PPE and any changes arising from the assessment are
	applied by the Company prospectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	Where an item of plant and equipment comprises major components with different useful lives, the components are accounted for as separate items of plant and equipment. Expenditures incurred to replace a component of an item of property, plant and equipment that is accounted for separately, including major inspection and overhaul expenditures are capitalized.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA-BOLD,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	3.4
	Decommissioning, restoration and similar liabilities ("Asset retirement
	obligation" or "ARO")
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	The Company recognizes
	liabilities for statutory, contractual, constructive or legal obligations,
	including those associated with the reclamation of mineral properties and PPE,
	when those obligations result from the acquisition, construction, development or
	normal operation of the Company's assets. Initially, a liability for an asset
	retirement obligation is recognized at its fair value in the period in which it
	is incurred. Upon initial recognition of the liability, the corresponding asset
	retirement obligation is added to the carrying amount of the related asset and
	the cost is amortized as an expense over the economic life of the asset using
	the declining balance method. Following the initial recognition of the asset
	retirement obligation, the carrying amount of the liability is increased for the
	passage of time and adjusted for changes to the current market
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="TT2F4T00,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	based discount rate, and adjusted for changes to the amount or timing of the underlying cash flows needed to settle the obligation. As of August 31, 2013, and 2012 no liability for asset retirement obligations exists.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA-BOLD,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	3.5 Share based payments
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<B>
<I>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA-BOLDOBLIQUE,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	Share based payment transactions
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	Employees (including
	directors and senior executives) of the Company receive a portion of their
	remuneration in the form of share based payment transactions, whereby employees
	render services as consideration for equity instruments ("equity
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="TT2F4T00,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	settled
	transactions").
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	In situations where equity instruments are issued and some or all of the goods or services received by the entity as consideration cannot be specifically identified, they are measured at fair value of the share
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="TT2F4T00,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	based payment.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT: X-SMALL HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	19
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; PADDING-RIGHT: 0%; PADDING-LEFT: 0%">
</DIV>
<HR NOSHADE ALIGN="CENTER" WIDTH="100%" SIZE=2>
<A NAME="eolPage165"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<!--$$/PAGE=-->
<A NAME="FINS_HTM_PAGE_20">
</A>
<BR>
<A NAME="FINS_HTM__BCLPAGEBORDER20">
</A>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; PADDING-RIGHT: 0%; PADDING-LEFT: 0%">
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; PADDING-RIGHT: 0%; PADDING-LEFT: 0%">
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; PADDING-RIGHT: 0%; PADDING-LEFT: 0%">
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="HELVETICA-BOLD,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	Tanzanian Royalty Exploration Corporation
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<B>
<FONT STYLE="FONT: X-SMALL HELVETICA-BOLD,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	Notes to the Consolidated Financial Statements
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<B>
<FONT STYLE="FONT: X-SMALL HELVETICA-BOLD,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	For the Years Ended August 31, 2013 and 2012
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA-BOLD,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	3. Summary of
	Significant Accounting Policies (continued)
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<B>
<FONT STYLE="FONT: X-SMALL HELVETICA-BOLD,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	3.5 Share based payments (continued)
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<B>
<I>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA-BOLDOBLIQUE,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	Equity settled transactions
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	The costs of equity
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="TT2F4T00,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	settled transactions with employees are measured by reference to the fair value at the date on which they are granted.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	The costs of equity
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="TT2F4T00,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	settled
	transactions are recognized, together with a corresponding increase in equity,
	over the period in which the performance and/or service conditions are
	fulfilled, ending on the date on which the relevant employees become fully
	entitled to the award ("the vesting date"). The cumulative expense is
	recognized for equity
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="TT2F4T00,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	settled
	transactions at each reporting date until the vesting date reflects the Company's
	best estimate of the number of equity instruments that will ultimately vest. The
	profit or loss charge or credit for a period represents the movement in
	cumulative expense recognized as at the beginning and end of that period and the
	corresponding amount is represented in share based payment reserve.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	No expense is recognized for awards that do not ultimately vest, except for awards where vesting is conditional upon a market condition, which are treated as vesting irrespective of whether or not the market condition is satisfied provided that all other performance and/or service conditions are satisfied.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	Where the terms of an equity
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="TT2F4T00,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	settled award are modified, the minimum expense recognized is the expense as if the terms had not been modified. An additional expense is recognized for any modification which increases the total fair value of the share
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="TT2F4T00,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	based payment arrangement, or is otherwise beneficial to the employee as measured at the date of modification.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	The effect of
	outstanding options is considered in the computation of earnings per share, if
	dilutive.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA-BOLD,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	3.6 Taxation
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	Income tax expense represents the sum of tax currently payable and deferred tax.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<B>
<I>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA-BOLDOBLIQUE,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	Current income tax
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	Current income tax assets and liabilities for the current and prior periods are measured at the amount expected to be recovered from or paid to the taxation authorities. The tax rates and tax laws used to compute the amount are those that are enacted or substantively enacted by the date of the statement of financial position.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<B>
<I>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA-BOLDOBLIQUE,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	Deferred income tax
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	Deferred income tax is provided using the liability method on temporary differences at the date of the statement of financial position between the tax bases of assets and liabilities and their carrying amounts for financial reporting purposes.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	Deferred income tax liabilities are recognized for all taxable temporary differences, except:
</FONT>
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; WIDTH: 100%">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 15PT; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT: X-SMALL HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	&bull;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 5PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT: X-SMALL HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	where
	the deferred income tax liability arises from the initial recognition of
	goodwill or of an asset or liability in a transaction that is not a business
	combination and, at the time of the transaction, affects neither the accounting
	profit nor taxable profit or loss; and
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 15PT; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT: X-SMALL HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	&bull;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 5PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT: X-SMALL HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	in
	respect of taxable temporary differences associated with investments in
	subsidiaries, associates and interests in joint ventures, where the timing of
	the reversal of the temporary differences can be controlled and it is probable
	that the temporary differences will not reverse in the foreseeable future.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT: X-SMALL HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	20
</FONT>
</P>
<P>
	&nbsp;
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; PADDING-RIGHT: 0%; PADDING-LEFT: 0%">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</DIV>

	&nbsp;

</A>
<BR>
<A NAME="FINS_HTM__BCLPAGEBORDER21">
</A>
<B>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; PADDING-RIGHT: 0%; PADDING-LEFT: 0%">
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; PADDING-RIGHT: 0%; PADDING-LEFT: 0%">
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; PADDING-RIGHT: 0%; PADDING-LEFT: 0%">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="HELVETICA-BOLD,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	Tanzanian Royalty Exploration Corporation
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT: X-SMALL HELVETICA-BOLD,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	Notes to the Consolidated Financial Statements
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT: X-SMALL HELVETICA-BOLD,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	For the Years Ended August 31, 2013 and 2012
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</B>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA-BOLD,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	3. Summary of
	Significant Accounting Policies (continued)
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<B>
<FONT STYLE="FONT: X-SMALL HELVETICA-BOLD,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	3.6 Taxation (continued)
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	Deferred income tax assets are recognized for all deductible temporary differences, carry forward of unused tax credits and unused tax losses, to the extent that it is probable that taxable profit will be available against which the deductible temporary differences and the carry forward of unused tax credits and unused tax losses can be utilized except:
</FONT>
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 15PT; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT: X-SMALL HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	&bull;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 5PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT: X-SMALL HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	where
	the deferred income tax asset relating to the deductible temporary difference
	arises from the initial recognition of an asset or liability in a transaction
	that is not a business combination and, at the time of the transaction, affects
	neither the accounting profit nor taxable profit or loss; and
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 15PT; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT: X-SMALL HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	&bull;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 5PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT: X-SMALL HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	in
	respect of deductible temporary differences associated with investments in
	subsidiaries, associates and interests in joint ventures, deferred income tax
	assets are recognized only to the extent that it is probable that the temporary
	differences will reverse in the foreseeable future and taxable profit will be
	available against which the temporary differences can be utilized.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT: X-SMALL HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	The carrying amount of deferred income tax assets is reviewed at each date of the statement of financial position and reduced to the extent that it is no longer probable that sufficient taxable profit will be available to allow all or part of the deferred income tax asset to be utilized. Unrecognized deferred income tax assets are reassessed at each date of the statement of financial position and are recognized to the extent that it has become probable that future taxable profit will allow the deferred tax asset to be recovered.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	Deferred income tax assets and liabilities are measured at the tax rates that are expected to apply to the year when the asset is realized or the liability is settled, based on tax rates (and tax laws) that have been enacted or substantively enacted at the date of the statement of financial position.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	Deferred income tax relating to items recognized directly in equity is recognized in equity and not in the statement of comprehensive loss.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	Deferred income tax assets and deferred income tax liabilities are offset if, and only if, a legally enforceable right exists to set off current tax assets against current tax liabilities and the deferred tax assets and liabilities relate to income taxes levied by the same taxation authority on either the same taxable entity or different taxable entities which intend to either settle current tax liabilities and assets on a net basis, or to realize the assets and settle the liabilities simultaneously, in each future period in which significant amounts of deferred tax assets or liabilities are expected to be settled or recovered.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA-BOLD,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	Sales tax
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	Expenses and assets are recognized net of the amount of sales tax, except:
</FONT>
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 15PT; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT: X-SMALL HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	&bull;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 5PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT: X-SMALL HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	When
	the sales tax incurred on a purchase of assets or services is not recoverable
	from the taxation authority, in which case the sales tax is recognised as part
	of the cost of acquisition of the asset or as part of the expense item, as
	applicable
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 15PT; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT: X-SMALL HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	&bull;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 5PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT: X-SMALL HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	When
	receivables and payables are stated with the amount of sales tax included
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT: X-SMALL HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	The net amount of sales tax recoverable from, or payable to, the taxation authority is included as part of receivables or payables in the statement of financial position.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT: X-SMALL HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	21
</FONT>
</P>
<P>
	&nbsp;
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; PADDING-RIGHT: 0%; PADDING-LEFT: 0%">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</DIV>

<A NAME="FINS_HTM__BCLPAGEBORDER22">
</A>
<P>
	&nbsp;
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; PADDING-RIGHT: 0%; PADDING-LEFT: 0%">
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; PADDING-RIGHT: 0%; PADDING-LEFT: 0%">
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; PADDING-RIGHT: 0%; PADDING-LEFT: 0%">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="HELVETICA-BOLD,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	Tanzanian Royalty Exploration Corporation
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<B>
<FONT STYLE="FONT: X-SMALL HELVETICA-BOLD,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	Notes to the Consolidated Financial Statements
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<B>
<FONT STYLE="FONT: X-SMALL HELVETICA-BOLD,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	For the Years Ended August 31, 2013 and 2012
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA-BOLD,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	3. Summary of
	Significant Accounting Policies (continued)
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA-BOLD,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	3.7 Loss per share
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	The basic loss per
	share is computed by dividing the net loss by the weighted average number of
	common shares outstanding during the period. The diluted loss per share reflects
	the potential dilution of common share equivalents, such as outstanding
	restricted stock units and share purchase warrants, in the weighted average
	number of common shares outstanding during the year, if dilutive.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA-BOLD,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	3.8 Financial assets
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	All financial assets are initially recorded at fair value and designated upon inception into one of the following four categories: held
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="TT2F4T00,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	to
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="TT2F4T00,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	maturity, available
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="TT2F4T00,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	for
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="TT2F4T00,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	sale, loans
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="TT2F4T00,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	and-receivables
	or at fair value through profit or loss ("FVTPL"). The Company initially
	recognizes loans and receivables on the date they are originated. All other
	financial assets are recognized on the trade date at which the Company becomes
	party to the contractual provisions of the instruments.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	Subsequent to initial
	recognition, financial assets classified as FVTPL are measured at fair value
	with unrealized gains and losses recognized through earnings. The Company's
	other financial assets are classified as FVTPL.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	Financial assets classified as loans
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="TT2F4T00,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	and
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="TT2F4T00,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	receivables and held
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="TT2F4T00,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	to
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="TT2F4T00,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	maturity
	are measured at amortized cost. The Company's cash and cash equivalents and
	trade and other receivables are classified as loans
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="TT2F4T00,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	and-receivables.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	Subsequent to initial recognition, financial assets classified as available
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="TT2F4T00,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	for
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="TT2F4T00,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	sale are measured at fair value with unrealized gains and losses recognized in other comprehensive income (loss) except for losses in value that are considered other than temporary. During the periods presented, the Company has not classified any financial assets as available
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="TT2F4T00,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	for
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="TT2F4T00,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	sale.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	Transactions costs
	associated with FVTPL financial assets are expensed as incurred, while
	transaction costs associated with all other financial assets are included in the
	initial carrying amount of the asset.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	The Company
	derecognizes a financial asset when the contractual rights to the cash flows
	from the asset expire, or it transfers the rights to receive the contractual
	cash flows on the financial asset in a transaction in which substantially all
	the rights and rewards of ownership of the financial asset are transferred.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA-BOLD,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	3.9 Financial liabilities
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	All financial
	liabilities are initially recorded at fair value and designated upon inception
	as FVTPL or other
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="TT2F4T00,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	financial
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="TT2F4T00,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	liabilities on the trade date at which the Company becomes party to the contractual provisions of the instrument.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	Financial liabilities classified as other
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="TT2F4T00,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	financial
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="TT2F4T00,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	liabilities are initially recognized at fair value less directly attributable transaction costs. After initial recognition, other
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="TT2F4T00,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	financial-liabilities
	are subsequently measured at amortized cost using the effective interest method.
	The effective interest method is a method of calculating the amortized cost of a
	financial liability and of allocating interest expense over the relevant period.
	The effective interest rate is the rate that exactly discounts estimated future
	cash payments through the expected life of the financial liability, or, where
	appropriate, a shorter period. The Company's trade and other payables and
	convertible debt are classified as other
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="TT2F4T00,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	financial
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="TT2F4T00,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	liabilities.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	Financial liabilities
	classified as FVTPL include financial liabilities held for trading and financial
	liabilities designated upon initial recognition as FVTPL. Derivatives, including
	separated embedded derivatives are also classified as FVTPL unless they are
	designated as effective hedging instruments. Fair value changes on financial
	liabilities classified as FVTPL are recognized through the statement of
	comprehensive loss. At August 31, 2013 and 2012 the Company's warrant
	liability has been classified as FVTPL.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	22
</FONT>
</P>
<P>
	&nbsp;
</P>

	&nbsp;

<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; PADDING-RIGHT: 0%; PADDING-LEFT: 0%">
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; PADDING-RIGHT: 0%; PADDING-LEFT: 0%">
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; PADDING-RIGHT: 0%; PADDING-LEFT: 0%">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="HELVETICA-BOLD,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	Tanzanian Royalty Exploration Corporation
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<B>
<FONT STYLE="FONT: X-SMALL HELVETICA-BOLD,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	Notes to the Consolidated Financial Statements
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<B>
<FONT STYLE="FONT: X-SMALL HELVETICA-BOLD,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	For the Years Ended August 31, 2013 and 2012
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA-BOLD,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	3. Summary of
	Significant Accounting Policies (continued)
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<B>
<FONT STYLE="FONT: X-SMALL HELVETICA-BOLD,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	3.9 Financial liabilities (continued)
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	The Company
	derecognizes a financial liability when its contractual obligations are
	discharged or cancelled, as they expire.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA-BOLD,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	3.10 Impairment of financial assets
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	The Company assesses at each date of the statement of financial position whether a financial asset is impaired.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<B>
<I>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA-BOLDOBLIQUE,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	Assets carried at amortized cost
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	If there is objective
	evidence that an impairment loss on assets carried at amortized cost has been
	incurred, the amount of the loss is measured as the difference between the asset's
	carrying amount and the present value of estimated future cash flows discounted
	at the financial asset's original effective interest rate. The carrying amount
	of the asset is then reduced by the amount of the impairment. The amount of the
	loss is recognized in profit or loss.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	If, in a subsequent period, the amount of the impairment loss decreases and the decrease can be related objectively to an event occurring after the impairment was recognized, the previously recognized impairment loss is reversed to the extent that the carrying value of the asset does not exceed what the amortized cost would have been had the impairment not been recognized. Any subsequent reversal of an impairment loss is recognized in profit or loss.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	In relation to trade
	receivables, a provision for impairment is made and an impairment loss is
	recognized in profit and loss when there is objective evidence (such as the
	probability of insolvency or significant financial difficulties of the debtor)
	that the Company will not be able to collect all of the amounts due under the
	original terms of the invoice. The carrying amount of the receivable is reduced
	through use of an allowance account. Impaired debts are written off against the
	allowance account when they are assessed as uncollectible.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<B>
<I>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA-BOLDOBLIQUE,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	Available-for-sale
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	If an available
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="TT2F4T00,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	for
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="TT2F4T00,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	sale asset is impaired, an amount comprising the difference between its cost and its current fair value, less any impairment loss previously recognized in profit or loss, is transferred from equity to profit or loss. Reversals in respect of equity instruments classified as available
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="TT2F4T00,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	for
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="TT2F4T00,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	sale are not recognized in profit or loss.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA-BOLD,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	3.11 Impairment of non-financial assets
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	At each date of the statement of financial position, the Company reviews the carrying amounts of its tangible and intangible assets to determine whether there is an indication that those assets have suffered an impairment loss. If any such indication exists, the recoverable amount of the asset is estimated in order to determine the extent of the impairment loss (if any). Where it is not possible to estimate the recoverable amount of an individual asset, the Company estimates the recoverable amount of the cash
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="TT2F4T00,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	generating unit to which the assets belong.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	Recoverable amount is the higher of fair value less costs to sell and value in use. In assessing value in use, the estimated future cash flows are discounted to their present value using a pre
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="TT2F4T00,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	tax discount rate that reflects current market assessments of the time value of money and the risks specific to the asset.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	If the recoverable amount of an asset (or cash
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="TT2F4T00,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	generating unit) is estimated to be less than its carrying amount, the carrying amount of the asset (or cash
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="TT2F4T00,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	generating unit) is reduced to its recoverable amount. An impairment loss is recognized immediately in the statement of comprehensive loss, unless the relevant asset is carried at a re-valued amount, in which case the impairment loss is treated as a revaluation decrease.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	23
</FONT>
</P>
<P>
	&nbsp;
</P>
