<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; PADDING-RIGHT: 0%; PADDING-LEFT: 0%">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="HELVETICA-BOLD,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	Tanzanian Royalty Exploration Corporation
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<B>
<FONT STYLE="FONT: X-SMALL HELVETICA-BOLD,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	Notes to the Consolidated Financial Statements
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<B>
<FONT STYLE="FONT: X-SMALL HELVETICA-BOLD,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	For the Years Ended August 31, 2013 and 2012
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA-BOLD,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	3. Summary of
	Significant Accounting Policies (continued)
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<B>
<FONT STYLE="FONT: X-SMALL HELVETICA-BOLD,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	3.11 Impairment of non-financial assets (continued)
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	Where an impairment loss subsequently reverses, the carrying amount of the asset (cash-generating unit) is increased to the revised estimate of its recoverable amount, but so that the increased carrying amount does not exceed the carrying amount that would have been determined had no impairment loss been recognized for the asset (or cash
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="TT2F4T00,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	generating unit) in prior years.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA-BOLD,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	3.12 Cash and cash equivalents
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	Cash and cash equivalents in the statement of financial position comprise cash at banks and on hand, and short term deposits with an original maturity of three months or less, which are readily convertible into a known amount of cash.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA-BOLD,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	3.13 Related party transactions
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	Parties are considered to be related if one party has the ability, directly or indirectly, to control the other party or exercise significant influence over the other party in making financial and operating decisions. Parties are also considered to be related if they are subject to common control or common significant influence. Related parties may be individuals or corporate entities. A transaction is considered to be a related party transaction when there is a transfer of resources or obligations between related parties. Related party transactions that are in the normal course of business and have commercial substance are measured at the exchange amount, being the amount agreed by the parties to the transaction.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA-BOLD,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	3.14 Foreign currency transactions
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<I>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA-OBLIQUE,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	Functional and presentation currency
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	Items included in the
	financial statements of each of the Company's entities are measured using the
	currency of the primary economic environment in which the entity operates ("the
	functional currency"). The functional currency of the Company and each of its
	subsidiaries is the Canadian Dollar ("CDN"). The consolidated financial
	statements are presented in Canadian Dollars which is the Company's
	presentation currency.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<I>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA-OBLIQUE,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	Transactions and balances
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	Foreign currency transactions are translated into the functional currency using the exchange rates prevailing at the dates of the transactions or valuation where items are re-measured. Foreign exchange gains and losses resulting from the settlement of such transactions and from the translation at period-end exchange rates of monetary assets and liabilities denominated in foreign currencies are recognized in the statement of comprehensive loss.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA-BOLD,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	3.15 Significant accounting judgments and estimates
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	The preparation of
	these consolidated financial statements requires management to make judgements
	and estimates and form assumptions that affect the reported amounts of assets
	and liabilities at the date of the financial statements and reported amounts of
	revenues and expenses during the reporting period. On an ongoing basis,
	management evaluates its judgements and estimates in relation to assets,
	liabilities, revenue and expenses. Management uses historical experience and
	various other factors it believes to be reasonable under the given circumstances
	as the basis for its judgements and estimates. Actual outcomes may differ from
	these estimates under different assumptions and conditions. The most significant
	estimates relate to the appropriate depreciation rate for property, plant and
	equipment, the valuation of warrant liability, the recoverability of accounts
	receivable, the valuation of deferred income tax amounts, impairment testing of
	mineral properties and deferred exploration and property, plant and equipment
	and the calculation of share
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="TT2F4T00,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	based
	payments. The most significant judgements relate to the recognition of deferred
	tax assets and liabilities and asset retirement obligations, the determination
	of the economic viability of a project or mineral property and the determination
	of functional currencies.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	24
</FONT>
</P>
<P>
	&nbsp;
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; PADDING-RIGHT: 0%; PADDING-LEFT: 0%">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</DIV>

	&nbsp;
</DIV>

<A NAME="FINS_HTM_PAGE_25">
</A>
<BR>
<A NAME="FINS_HTM__BCLPAGEBORDER25">
</A>
<B>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; PADDING-RIGHT: 0%; PADDING-LEFT: 0%">
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; PADDING-RIGHT: 0%; PADDING-LEFT: 0%">
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; PADDING-RIGHT: 0%; PADDING-LEFT: 0%">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="HELVETICA-BOLD,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	Tanzanian Royalty Exploration Corporation
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT: X-SMALL HELVETICA-BOLD,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	Notes to the Consolidated Financial Statements
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT: X-SMALL HELVETICA-BOLD,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	For the Years Ended August 31, 2013 and 2012
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</B>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA-BOLD,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	3. Summary of
	Significant Accounting Policies (continued)
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA-BOLD,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	3.16 Inventory
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	Inventory consists of
	supplies for the Company's drilling rig to be consumed during the course of
	exploration development and operations. Cost represents the delivered price of
	the item.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA-BOLD,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	4. Mineral Properties
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	The Company explores or
	acquires gold or other precious metal concessions through its own efforts or
	through the efforts of its subsidiaries. All of the Company's concessions are
	located in Tanzania.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	The Company's mineral
	interests in Tanzania are initially held under prospecting licenses granted
	pursuant to the Mining Act, 2010 (Tanzania) for a period of up to four years,
	and are renewable two times for a period of up to two years each. Annual rental
	fees for prospecting licenses are based on the total area of the license
	measured in square kilometres, multiplied by USD$100/sq.km for the initial
	period, USD$150/sq.km for the first renewal and USD$200/sq.km for the second
	renewal. With each renewal at least 50% of the licensed area, if greater than 20
	square kilometres, must be relinquished and if the Company wishes to keep the
	relinquished one-half portion, it must file a new application for the
	relinquished portion. There is also an initial one-time "preparation fee" of
	USD$500 per license. Upon renewal, there is a renewal fee of USD$300 per
	license.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	Certain of the Company's
	prospecting licenses are currently being renewed.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	The Company assessed the carrying value of mineral properties and deferred exploration costs as at August 31, 2013 and recorded a write-down of &#36;2,194,907 during the year ended August 31, 2013 (2012 - &#36;1,293,969).
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	25
</FONT>
</P>
<P>
	&nbsp;
</P>

</TD>
</TR>

<A NAME="FINS_HTM_PAGE_27">

<A NAME="FINS_HTM__BCLPAGEBORDER27">
</A>
<P>
	&nbsp;
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; PADDING-RIGHT: 0%; PADDING-LEFT: 0%">
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; PADDING-RIGHT: 0%; PADDING-LEFT: 0%">
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; PADDING-RIGHT: 0%; PADDING-LEFT: 0%">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="HELVETICA-BOLD,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	Tanzanian Royalty Exploration Corporation
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<B>
<FONT STYLE="FONT: X-SMALL HELVETICA-BOLD,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	Notes to the Consolidated Financial Statements
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<B>
<FONT STYLE="FONT: X-SMALL HELVETICA-BOLD,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	For the Years Ended August 31, 2013 and 2012
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE BORDER=0 CELLSPACING=0>
<TR>
<TD NOWRAP VALIGN=TOP WIDTH="2%">
<B>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA-BOLD,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	4.
</FONT>
</B>
	&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="98%">
<B>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA-BOLD,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	Mineral Properties (continued)
</FONT>
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD NOWRAP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD NOWRAP VALIGN=TOP WIDTH="2%">
<B>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA-BOLD,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	(a)
</FONT>
</B>
	&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="98%">
<B>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA-BOLD,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	Itetemia
	Project:
</FONT>
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD NOWRAP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	Through prospecting and
	mining option agreements, the Company has options to acquire interests in
	several ltetemia property prospecting licenses. The prospecting licenses
	comprising the Itetemia property are held by the Company; through the Company's
	subsidiaries, Tancan or Tanzam. In the case of one prospecting license, Tancan
	acquired its interest pursuant to the State Mining Corporation ("Stamico")
	Venture Agreement dated July 12, 1994, as amended June 18, 2001, July 2005, and
	October 13, 2008.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	Stamico retains a 2%
	royalty interest as well as a right to earn back an additional 20% interest in
	the prospecting license by meeting 20% of the costs required to place the
	property into production. The Company retains the right to purchase one-half of
	Stamico's 2% royalty interest in exchange for USD$1,000,000.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	The Company is required
	to pay Stamico an annual option fee of USD$25,000 per annum until commercial
	production.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	As at August 31, 2013,
	there are no licenses subject to an Option Agreement with Barrick Exploration
	Africa Ltd. (BEAL) (note 4(m)).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	During the year ended August 31, 2013, the Company did not abandon any licenses in the area and no write off was taken in this area (year ended August 31, 2012 - &#36;46,544) related to deferred exploration costs associated with licenses the Company does not intend to renew.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA-BOLD,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	(b) Luhala
	Project:
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	During the year ended August 31, 2013, the Company agreed to abandon 5 licenses in the area and a write-off of &#36;6,983 was taken in this area (year ended August 31, 2012 - &#36;nil).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA-BOLD,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	(c) Kigosi:
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	The Kigosi Project is
	principally located within the Kigosi Game Reserve controlled area. Through
	prospecting and mining option agreements, the Company has options to acquire
	interests in several Kigosi prospecting licenses. The Company has an agreement
	with Stamico providing Stamico a 15% carried interest in the Kigosi Project.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	The Kigosi Mining
	Licence application with an area of 9.91 sq km was officially lodged with the
	Ministry of Energy and Minerals (MEM) on 4
</FONT>
<SUP>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	th
</FONT>
</SUP>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	March
	2013 after some amendments as required by the Ministry. The Kigosi Mining
	License application was given a number and sent to the Minister for signature.
	The application covers parts of two licences and the licences will cease after
	the grant of the Mining Licence. Company management, together with Ministry
	officials will be attending the Kigosi Mining Licence signing ceremony where the
	Kigosi Project will be officially handed over to the Company. Subsequent to the
	period end the official signing ceremony took place and the Kigosi Mining
	Licence has been signed by the respective Ministries.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	During the year ended August 31, 2013, the Company abandoned 10 licenses not considered core to the main targeted mining area therefore a write off &#36;469,940 was taken for these licenses related to the property (year ended August 31, 2012 - &#36;nil).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<B>
<FONT COLOR="#2A2A2A" SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA-BOLD,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	(d)
	Lunguya:
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	During the year ended August 31, 2013, the Company abandoned 8 licenses not considered core properties in the area and a write-off of &#36;103,636 was taken in this area (year ended August 31, 2012 -&#36;nil).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	27
</FONT>
</P>
<P>
	&nbsp;

<TD NOWRAP COLSPAN="2" STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<B>
<FONT STYLE="FONT: X-SMALL HELVETICA-BOLD,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	(e)
</FONT>
</B>
	&nbsp;
<B>
<FONT STYLE="FONT: X-SMALL HELVETICA-BOLD,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	Kanagele:
</FONT>
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD NOWRAP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	&nbsp;

<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	During the year ended August 31, 2013, the Company agreed to abandon 5 licenses in the area and a write-off of &#36;892,727 was taken for this property (year ended August 31, 2012 - &#36;297,588), as the Company is focusing its exploration efforts on other projects at this time, however, the Company may consider future exploration development on the license.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA-BOLD,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	(f) Tulawaka:
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	The Company owns or has
	options to acquire interests ranging from 65% to 90% in the licenses through
	prospecting and option agreements. Three licenses in the Tulawaka area were
	subject to an option agreement with MDN Inc. (MDN) (note 4(n)).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	During the year ended August 31, 2013, the Company agreed to abandon 5 licenses in the area and a write-off of &#36;405,688 was taken for this property (year ended August 31, 2012 - &#36;331,402), as the Company is focusing its exploration efforts on other projects at this time, however, the Company may consider future exploration development on the license.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA-BOLD,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	(g) Ushirombo:
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	During the year ended August 31, 2013, the Company agreed to abandon 4 licenses in the area and a write-off of &#36;38,531 was taken for this property (year ended August 31, 2012 - &#36;266,379), as the Company is focusing its exploration efforts on other projects at this time, however, the Company may consider future exploration development on the license.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA-BOLD,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	(h) Mbogwe:
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	During the year ended August 31, 2013, the Company did not abandon any licenses in the area and a write-off of &#36;84,853 was taken for this property (year ended August 31, 2012 - &#36;13,019), as the Company is focusing its exploration efforts on other projects at this time, however, the Company may consider future exploration development on the license.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA-BOLD,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	(i) Biharamulo:
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	Five Biharamulo
	licenses were subject to the option agreement with MDN (note 4(n)).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	During the year ended August 31, 2013, the Company agreed to abandon 4 licenses in the area and a write-off of &#36;16,906 was taken for this property (year ended August 31, 2012 - &#36;129,290), The Company is focusing its exploration efforts on other projects at this time, however, the Company may consider future exploration development on the license.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	28
</FONT>
</P>
<P>
	&nbsp;
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; PADDING-RIGHT: 0%; PADDING-LEFT: 0%">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</DIV>
<HR NOSHADE ALIGN="CENTER" WIDTH="100%" SIZE=2>
<A NAME="eolPage174"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;

<!--$$/PAGE=-->
<A NAME="FINS_HTM_PAGE_29">
</A>
<BR>
<A NAME="FINS_HTM__BCLPAGEBORDER29">
</A>
<P>
	&nbsp;
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; PADDING-RIGHT: 0%; PADDING-LEFT: 0%">
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; PADDING-RIGHT: 0%; PADDING-LEFT: 0%">
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; PADDING-RIGHT: 0%; PADDING-LEFT: 0%">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="HELVETICA-BOLD,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	Tanzanian Royalty Exploration Corporation
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<B>
<FONT STYLE="FONT: X-SMALL HELVETICA-BOLD,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	Notes to the Consolidated Financial Statements
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<B>
<FONT STYLE="FONT: X-SMALL HELVETICA-BOLD,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	For the Years Ended August 31, 2013 and 2012
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE BORDER=0 CELLSPACING=0>
<TR>
<TD NOWRAP VALIGN=TOP WIDTH="2%">
<B>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA-BOLD,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	4.
</FONT>
</B>
	&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="98%">
<B>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA-BOLD,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	Mineral Properties (continued)
</FONT>
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD NOWRAP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD NOWRAP VALIGN=TOP WIDTH="2%">
<B>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA-BOLD,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	(j)
</FONT>
</B>
	&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="98%">
<B>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA-BOLD,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	Buckreef Gold
	Project:
</FONT>
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD NOWRAP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	On December 21, 2010,
	the Company announced it was the successful bidder for the Buckreef Gold Mine
	Re-development Project in northern Tanzania (the Buckreef Project). Pursuant to
	the terms of the heads of agreement dated December 16, 2010, the Company paid
	USD $3,000,000 to Stamico in consideration of the transaction. On October 25,
	2011, a Definitive Joint Venture Agreement was entered into with Stamico for the
	development of the Buckreef Gold Project. Through its wholly-owned subsidiary,
	Tanzania American International Development Corporation 2000 Limited (Tanzam),
	the Company holds a 55% interest in the joint venture company, Buckreef Gold
	Company Limited, with Stamico holding the remaining 45%. The comparative
	statement of financial position has been adjusted to reflect an immaterial
	adjustment relating to recording NCI in respect of Stamico's 45% interest.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	The Company has 100%
	control over all aspects of the joint venture company. In accordance with the
	joint venture agreement, the Company has to arrange financing, incur
	expenditure, make all decisions and operate the mine in the future. The Company's
	obligations and commitments include completing a preliminary economic
	assessment, feasibility study and mine development. Stamico's involvement is
	to contribute the licences and rights to the property and received a 45%
	interest in Buckreef Gold Company Limited.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	The joint venture agreement contains an obligation clause regarding the commissioning date for the plant. If the property has not been brought into production by May 31, 2014, the Company shall be entitled to extend the date for one additional year:
</FONT>
</P>
<TABLE BORDER=0 CELLSPACING=0>
<TR>
<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="2%" STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	i)
</FONT>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="98%">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	for the extension year,
	on payment to Stamico of US$500,000;
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="2%" STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	ii)
</FONT>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="98%">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	for the second
	extension year, on payment to Stamico of US$625,000; and
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="2%" STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	iii)
</FONT>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="98%">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	for each subsequent
	extension year, on payment to Stamico of US$750,000.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD NOWRAP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	The Company has
	recognized a non-controlling interest (NCI) in respect of Stamico's 45%
	interest on the Consolidated Financial Statements based on the initial payment
	by the Company to Stamico and will be adjusted based on annual exploration and
	related expenditures. Stamico has a free carried interest and does not
	contribute to exploration expenses.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	There is supervisory
	board made up of 4 directors of Tanzam and 3 of Stamico who will be updated with
	periodic reports and review major decisions. Amounts paid to Stamico and
	subsequent expenditure on the property were capitalized under Mineral Properties
	and reported under Buckreef Gold Company Limited.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA-BOLD,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	(k) Kabanga:
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	The Kabanga Project is
	located in northwestern Tanzania, south of Lake Victoria and near the Burundi
	border within the Mesoproterozoic Karagwe-Ankolean sequence within the Kibaran
	Fold Belt of NW Tanzania.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	The Company is engaged
	in the exploration and development of the Kagera Nickel project, adjacent to the
	Barrick/Xstrata Kabanga Nickel Project within the Kabanga-Musongati
	mafic-ultramafic belt, which contains Ni sulphide ores at Kabanga deposit and
	reef-type PGE concentrations at Musongati.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	During the year ended August 31, 2013, the company abandoned 6 licenses not considered core and a write off of &#36;147,429 was taken (year ended August 31, 2012 &#36;nil).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	Northwestern Basemetals
	Company Limited, a new company 75% owned by the Company, 15% owned by Stamico
	and 10% owned by Songshan Mining Company was formed to explore the Kabanga
	nickel, cobalt and platinum group metals belt in Tanzania. Stamico has a carried
	interest on the Company and Songshan has a carried interest.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	29
</FONT>
</P>
<P>
	&nbsp;
</P>

<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
	&nbsp;

<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="HELVETICA-BOLD,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	Tanzanian Royalty Exploration Corporation
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<B>
<FONT STYLE="FONT: X-SMALL HELVETICA-BOLD,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">

<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<B>

<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA-BOLD,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	4. Mineral
	Properties (continued) (l) Other properties:
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	The Company has options to acquire interests in their other properties. To maintain these options and licenses, the Company made the following payment:
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT">
<TABLE BORDER="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 46%">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 53%">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<TD ALIGN=LEFT STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000;">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN=LEFT STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	USD$
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<TD ALIGN=LEFT>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	2013
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN=LEFT STYLE="TEXT-INDENT:0.000366PT">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	19,000
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	During the year ended August 31, 2013, the Company did not abandon any licenses in the area but recorded a write-off of &#36;28,214 (year ended August 31, 2012 - &#36;209,747) of costs related to the abandoned area located within the other properties category.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA-BOLD,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	(m) Option
	Agreement with BEAL (now ABG Exploration Limited ("ABG"):
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	BEAL had the option to acquire the total rights, titles, and interests of the Company in prospecting licenses in various properties, herein called the BEAL project. In exchange for this option, BEAL paid USD&#36;100 to the Company. To maintain and exercise the option, BEAL was required to incur USD&#36;250,000 in exploration and development costs on the BEAL project within a year of closing the agreement (completed), and thereafter, BEAL must expend USD&#36;50,000 each year for each retained prospecting license. In addition, BEAL must make USD&#36;40,000 annual payments to the Company for each retained prospecting licenses in December 2006 and subsequent years.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	In prior years, the
	Company received from BEAL notices of relinquishment for all rights, titles and
	interests in prospecting licenses included in the Option Agreement, and on April
	18, 2013, ABG advised that they were returning the last remaining prospecting
	licence optioned under the BEAL Option Agreement.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA-BOLD,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	(n) Option
	Agreement with MDN:
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	On January 20, 2003, as
	amended on March 18, 2003 and January 9, 2007, the Company entered into an
	agreement with MDN granting MDN the exclusive option to acquire the total
	rights, titles, and interests of the Company in certain prospecting licenses.
	The prospecting licenses under option to MDN are located at Biharamulo and
	Tulawaka.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	In January 2013 MDN
	advised the Company that they were unable to fulfill the terms of the option
	agreement between the Company and MDN and the option agreement has been
	terminated. The Company is focusing its exploration efforts on other projects at
	this time, however, the Company may consider future exploration development on
	these licenses.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	30
</FONT>
</P>

	&nbsp;

<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;

<!--$$/PAGE=-->
<A NAME="FINS_HTM_PAGE_33">
</A>
<BR>
<A NAME="FINS_HTM__BCLPAGEBORDER33">
</A>
<B>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; PADDING-RIGHT: 0%; PADDING-LEFT: 0%">
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; PADDING-RIGHT: 0%; PADDING-LEFT: 0%">
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; PADDING-RIGHT: 0%; PADDING-LEFT: 0%">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="HELVETICA-BOLD,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	Tanzanian Royalty Exploration Corporation
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT: X-SMALL HELVETICA-BOLD,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	Notes to the Consolidated Financial Statements
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT: X-SMALL HELVETICA-BOLD,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	For the Years Ended August 31, 2013 and 2012
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</B>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA-BOLD,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	6. Convertible Debt (continued)
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	On August 17, 2010, the
	Company issued a three-year convertible promissory note to an arm's length
	third party, in the principal amount of $1,000,000 bearing interest at 3% and
	convertible into 255,484 common shares at a price of $4.286 per share. The
	agreement charged finance and commitment fees of $95,000 which was paid by
	issuing 22,166 common shares. In September 2011, the loan was converted into
	233,318 shares (see note 8).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	On September 23, 2010
	the Company completed a private placement with an arm's length third party
	consisting of a three-year convertible promissory note in the principal amount
	of $1,000,000 bearing interest at 3% and convertible into 221,337 common shares
	at the price of $4.518 per share. The Company received notice to convert the
	Promissory Note in the principal amount of $1,000,000 and 221,337 shares were
	issued on October 17, 2012 (see note 8).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	On October 4, 2010 the
	Company completed a private placement with arm's length third parties
	consisting of three-year convertible promissory notes in the aggregate principal
	amount of $1,060,000 bearing interest at 3% and convertible into 204,772 common
	shares at the price of $5.1765 per share. Subsequent to year end, the notes were
	repaid (see note 23).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	Each of the convertible
	debentures includes a conversion feature. The Company determined a fair value of
	the financial liability by obtaining independent bank rates of 4.25% for the
	August, September and October 2010 debt, assuming a three-year expected life and
	assigned the residual value of all debts to the equity conversion feature in the
	amount of $105,953. Total transaction costs for all debt agreements were
	$141,813 of which $4,911 was allocated to the equity component, which aggregated
	to $35,899 at August 31, 2013 (August 31, 2012 - $70,404) and is included in
	share based payment reserve in shareholders' equity.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA-BOLD,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	7. Other financial assets
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	Other financial assets
	are comprised of shares of publicly traded companies. As at August 31, 2013,
	these investments have been measured at their fair value of $5,250 (August 31,
	2012 - $17,850). The impact to the consolidated financial statements of this
	revaluation to market value for the year ended August 31, 2013 resulted in a
	$12,600 loss (2012 - $11,550 loss) as market values of these securities
	decreased (2012 - decreased) in the year.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	33
</FONT>
</P>

	&nbsp;

<TD COLSPAN=4>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<TD ALIGN=CENTER STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA-BOLD,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	Activity during the year ended August 31, 2012:
</FONT>
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN=LEFT>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN=RIGHT>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN=LEFT>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	On September 23, 2011,
	pursuant to the private placement completed on August 17, 2010, the Company
	received notice from an arm's length third party to convert its Promissory
	Note in the principal amount of $1,000,000 bearing interest at 3% and
	convertible into 233,318 common shares at a price of $4.286 per share, and
	233,318 shares were issued on September 23, 2011.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT COLOR="#0C0C0C" SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	On
	January 25, 2012 the Company issued 25,000 common shares common shares at a
	price of $2.619 per share respectively to an arm's length third party in
	satisfaction of finder's services provided to the Company in connection with a
	previous transaction. On April 23, 2012 the Company issued 10,000 common shares
	at a price of $5.036 to an arm's length third party for investor relations
	services.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<B>
<U>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA-BOLD,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	Activity during the year ended August 31, 2013:
</FONT>
</U>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	On October 17, 2012,
	pursuant to the private placement completed on September 23, 2010, the Company
	received notice from an arm's length third party to convert its Promissory
	Note in the principal amount of $1,000,000 bearing interest at 3% and
	convertible into 221,337 common shares at a price of $4.518 per share, and
	221,337 shares were issued on October 17, 2012.
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	* warrants classified under Warrant Liability ** expired unexercised subsequent to year end
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	Effective December 7, 2011 the exercise price of 5,263,158 common share purchase warrants was
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	reduced from USD&#36;6.25 to USD&#36;4.00 and the term of the warrants was extended one year to expire August 12, 2014. In addition, if the weighted average trading price of the common shares increases to USD&#36;6.50 after March 11, 2012, the Company will be entitled to require that the holders exercise the warrants, failing which the warrants will terminate. 368,421 compensation warrants issued under the prospectus financing have been amended in the same manner and re-priced from USD&#36;5.91 to USD&#36;4.00. The 5,263,158 warrants are accounted for and included in the calculation of the warrant liability. The compensation warrants continue to be classified as an equity instrument under warrants reserve and the increase in value of &#36;183,000 from the modification of the warrants was recorded in the statement of loss and comprehensive loss for the year ended August 31, 2012.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	35

<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA-BOLD,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	8. Capital Stock (continued)
</FONT>
</B>
<BR>
<BR>
<B>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA-BOLD,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	Warrant liability:
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	Foreign currency
	denominated warrants (not including compensation warrants), are considered a
	derivative as they are not indexed solely to the entity's own stock. The
	Company's functional currency is the Canadian dollar as such the warrants
	whose exercise price is denominated in US dollars have been recorded under
	liabilities and carried at fair value as determined by the Black-Scholes option
	pricing model, with changes in fair values recorded as gains or losses in the
	statements of comprehensive loss.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	The table below shows the activity for warrant liability for the year ended August 31, 2013 and the year ended August 31, 2012:
</FONT>
</P>

<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	&#36;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN=RIGHT STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:3PX DOUBLE #000000;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	8,114,000
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD COLSPAN=6>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<TD ALIGN=LEFT STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000;" STYLE="TEXT-INDENT:0.000031PT">

	Current portion of warrant liability
</FONT>
</TD>

<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	&#36;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN=RIGHT STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	8,114,000
</FONT>
</TD>

</TABLE>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; PADDING-RIGHT: 0%; PADDING-LEFT: 0%">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	During the year ended
	August 31, 2013, the value of the warrants decreased to $3,524,000 from the
	balance at August 31, 2012 of $8,114,000, as a result of changes in fair value
	of warrants during the year. The assumptions in valuing the warrants at August
	31, 2013 included an expected volatility of 64-83% (August 31, 2012 -
	58%-71%), a US risk free interest rate of 0.03% to 0.13% (August 31, 2012 -
	1.16%) and an expected life ranging from 2 to 12 months (August 31, 2012 - one
	to two years). The decrease in value of $4,590,000 (2012 - $2,321,921
	increase) has been recorded as a gain (2012 - loss) in the statement of
	comprehensive loss.
</FONT>
</P>
<TABLE BORDER=0 CELLSPACING=0>
<TR>
<TD NOWRAP VALIGN=TOP WIDTH="2%">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	(i)
</FONT>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="98%">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	Effective January 25,
	2012 the exercise price of 125,000 common share purchase warrants was reduced
	from CDN $7.309 to USD$4.00, and the term of the warrants was extended one year
	to expire October 20, 2013. In addition, if the weighted average trading price
	of the common shares increases to USD$6.50 after April 12, 2012, the Company
	will be entitled to require that the holders exercise the warrants, failing
	which the warrants will terminate. The warrants are held by an arm's length
	investor. The result of the modification resulted in the new foreign currency
	denominated warrants being considered a derivative as they are not indexed
	solely to the entity's own stock. The warrants were transferred from reserve
	for warrants to liabilities and were accounted for and included in the
	calculation of the warrant liability and consequently reclassified $80,829 from
	warrants reserve to warrant liability.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT: X-SMALL HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	36
</FONT>
</P>

<A NAME="eolPage182"></A>

	&nbsp;

<A NAME="FINS_HTM_PAGE_37">
</A>
<BR>
<A NAME="FINS_HTM__BCLPAGEBORDER37">
</A>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; PADDING-RIGHT: 0%; PADDING-LEFT: 0%">
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; PADDING-RIGHT: 0%; PADDING-LEFT: 0%">
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; PADDING-RIGHT: 0%; PADDING-LEFT: 0%">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="HELVETICA-BOLD,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	Tanzanian Royalty Exploration Corporation
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<B>
<FONT STYLE="FONT: X-SMALL HELVETICA-BOLD,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	Notes to the Consolidated Financial Statements
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<B>
<FONT STYLE="FONT: X-SMALL HELVETICA-BOLD,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	For the Years Ended August 31, 2013 and 2012
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA-BOLD,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	8. Capital Stock (continued)
</FONT>
</B>
<BR>
<BR>
<B>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA-BOLD,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	Compensation options:
</FONT>
</B>
<BR>
<BR>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	Employee stock ownership plan:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	On May 1, 2003, the
	Company established a non-leveraged employee stock ownership plan (ESOP) for all
	eligible employees, consultants, and directors. The Company matches 100 percent
	of participants' contributions up to 5 percent of the participants' salaries
	and 50 percent of participants' contributions between 6 percent and 30 percent
	of the participants' salaries. All contributions vest immediately. ESOP
	compensation expense for the year ended August 31, 2013 was $58,864 (2012 -
	$70,859) and is included in salaries and benefits expense.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	Restricted share units:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	The Restricted Stock
	Unit Plan (RSU Plan) is intended to enhance the Company's and its affiliates'
	abilities to attract and retain highly qualified officers, directors, key
	employees and other persons, and to motivate such officers, directors, key
	employees and other persons to serve the Company and its affiliates and to
	expend maximum effort to improve the business results and earnings of the
	Company, by providing to such persons an opportunity to acquire or increase a
	direct proprietary interest in the operations and future success of the Company.
	To this end, the RSU Plan provides for the grant of restricted stock units (RSUs).
	Each RSU represents an entitlement to one common share of the Company, upon
	vesting. As of November 9, 2012 the Board resolved to suspend 1,500,000 of the
	2,500,000 common shares previously authorized for issuance under the RSU Plan,
	such that a maximum of 1,000,000 shares shall be authorized for issuance under
	the RSU Plan, until such suspension may be lifted or further amended. RSU awards
	may, but need not, be subject to performance incentives to reward attainment of
	annual or long-term performance goals in accordance with the terms of the RSU
	Plan. Any such performance goals are specified in the award agreement.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	The Board of Directors
	implemented the RSU Plan under which officers, directors, employees and others
	are compensated for their services to the Company. Annual compensation for
	outside directors is $68,750 per year, plus $6,875 per year for serving on
	Committees, plus $3,437 per year for serving as Chair of a Committee. On April
	11, 2012 the board approved that at the election of each individual director, up
	to one half of the annual compensation may be received in cash, paid quarterly.
	The remainder of the director's annual compensation (at least one half, and up
	to 100%) will be awarded as RSUs in accordance with the terms of the RSU Plan
	and shall vest within a minimum of one (1) year and a maximum of three (3)
	years, at the election of the director, subject to the conditions of the RSU
	Plan with respect to earlier vesting. In 2012 outside directors had the option
	to elect to receive 100% of their compensation in RSUs. If 100% compensation in
	RSUs is elected, the compensation on which the number of RSUs granted in excess
	of the required one half shall be increased by 20%.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	The Company uses the
	fair value method to recognize the obligation and compensation expense
	associated with the RSU's. The fair value of RSU's issued is determined on
	the grant date based on the market price of the common shares on the grant date
	multiplied by the number of RSUs granted. The fair value is expensed over the
	vesting term. Upon redemption of the RSU the carrying amount is recorded as an
	increase in common share capital and a reduction in the share based payment
	reserve.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	The Company has a RSU
	Plan which allows the Company to issue RSU's which are redeemable for the
	issue of common shares at prevailing market prices on the date of the RSU grant.
	The aggregate number of RSU's outstanding is limited to a maximum of ten
	percent of the outstanding common shares. The Company has granted RSU's to
	officers and key employees.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	Of the 1,000,000 shares authorized for issuance under the Plan, 873,361 shares have been issued as at August 31, 2013.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	37
</FONT>
</P>
<P>
	&nbsp;
</P>

	&nbsp;

<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA-BOLD,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	11. Related party transactions and key management compensation
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	Related parties include the Board of Directors and officers, close family members and enterprises that are controlled by these individuals as well as certain consultants performing similar functions.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	Related party transactions conducted in the normal course of operations are measured at the exchange value (the amount established and agreed to by the related parties).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">

<FONT STYLE="FONT: 7PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	(2)
</FONT>
	,

<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<SUP>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	(1)
</FONT>
</SUP>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	Salaries
	and benefits include director fees. The board of directors do not have
	employment or service contracts with the Company. Directors are entitled to
	director fees and RSU's for their services and officers are entitled to cash
	remuneration and RSU's for their services.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<SUP>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	(2)
</FONT>
</SUP>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	Compensation shares may carry restrictive legends.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<SUP>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	(3)
</FONT>
</SUP>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	All
	RSU share based compensation is based on the accounting expense recorded in the
	year.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	39
</FONT>

<A NAME="FINS_HTM__BCLPAGEBORDER40">
</A>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; PADDING-RIGHT: 0%; PADDING-LEFT: 0%">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<B>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; PADDING-RIGHT: 0%; PADDING-LEFT: 0%">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
	&nbsp;
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; PADDING-RIGHT: 0%; PADDING-LEFT: 0%">
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; PADDING-RIGHT: 0%; PADDING-LEFT: 0%">
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; PADDING-RIGHT: 0%; PADDING-LEFT: 0%">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="HELVETICA-BOLD,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	Tanzanian Royalty Exploration Corporation
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT: X-SMALL HELVETICA-BOLD,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	Notes to the Consolidated Financial Statements
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT: X-SMALL HELVETICA-BOLD,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	For the Years Ended August 31, 2013 and 2012
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</B>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA-BOLD,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	12. Management of Capital
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	The Company's objective when managing capital is to obtain adequate levels of funding to support its exploration activities, to obtain corporate and administrative functions necessary to support organizational functioning and obtain sufficient funding to further the identification and development of precious metals deposits.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	The Company manages its
	capital structure and makes adjustments to it, based on the funds available to
	the Company, in order to support the acquisition, exploration and development of
	mineral properties. The Board of Directors does not establish quantitative
	return on capital criteria for management, but rather relies on the expertise of
	the Company's management to sustain future development of the business. The
	Company defines capital to include its shareholders' equity. In order to carry
	out the planned exploration and pay for administrative costs, the Company will
	spend its existing working capital and raise additional amounts as needed. The
	Company will continue to assess new properties and seek to acquire an interest
	in additional properties if it feels there is sufficient geologic or economic
	potential and if it has adequate financial resources to do so. Management
	reviews its capital management approach on an ongoing basis and believes that
	this approach, given the relative size of the Company, is reasonable. There were
	no changes in the Company's approach to capital management during the year ended
	August 31, 2013. The Company is not subject to externally imposed capital
	requirements.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	The Company considers
	its capital to be shareholders' equity, which is comprised of share capital,
	reserves, and deficit, which as at August 31, 2013 totaled $50,240,712 (August
	31, 2012 - $50,919,401).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	The Company raises capital, as necessary, to meet its needs and take advantage of perceived opportunities and, therefore, does not have a numeric target for its capital structure. Funds are primarily secured through equity capital raised by way of private placements. There can be no assurance that the Company will be able to continue raising equity capital in this manner.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	Management reviews its capital management approach on an ongoing basis and believes that this approach, given the relative size of the Company, is reasonable.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	The Company invests all capital that is surplus to its immediate operational needs in short term, liquid and highly rated financial instruments, such as cash, and short term guarantee deposits, all held with major Canadian financial institutions and Canadian treasury deposits.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA-BOLD,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	13. Financial Instruments
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<B>
<I>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA-BOLDOBLIQUE,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	Fair Value of Financial Instruments
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	The Company designated
	its other financial assets and warrant liability as FVTPL, which are measured at
	fair value. Fair value of other financial assets is determined based on quoted
	market prices and is categorized as Level 1 measurement. Fair value of warrant
	liability is categorized as Level 3 measurement as it is calculated based on
	unobservable market inputs. Trade and other receivables and cash and cash
	equivalents are classified as loans and receivables, which are measured at
	amortized cost. Trade and other payables and convertible debt are classified as
	other financial liabilities, which are measured at amortized cost. Fair value of
	trade and other payables and convertible debt are determined from transaction
	values that are not based on observable market data.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	The carrying value of
	the Company's cash and cash equivalents, trade and other receivables, trade
	and other payables approximate their fair value due to the relatively short term
	nature of these instruments.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	The Company's
	convertible debt fair value is based on market interest rate. As at August 31,
	2013, and August 31, 2012 the fair value of the convertible debt agreements did
	not differ materially from their carrying value, due to the short time to
	maturity.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	40
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>

<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; PADDING-RIGHT: 0%; PADDING-LEFT: 0%">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<B>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; PADDING-RIGHT: 0%; PADDING-LEFT: 0%">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
	&nbsp;
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; PADDING-RIGHT: 0%; PADDING-LEFT: 0%">
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; PADDING-RIGHT: 0%; PADDING-LEFT: 0%">
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; PADDING-RIGHT: 0%; PADDING-LEFT: 0%">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="HELVETICA-BOLD,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	Tanzanian Royalty Exploration Corporation
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT: X-SMALL HELVETICA-BOLD,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	Notes to the Consolidated Financial Statements
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT: X-SMALL HELVETICA-BOLD,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	For the Years Ended August 31, 2013 and 2012
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT: X-SMALL HELVETICA-BOLD,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</B>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA-BOLD,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	13. Financial Instruments (continued)
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	Fair value estimates are made at a specific point in time, based on relevant market information and information about financial instruments. These estimates are subject to and involve uncertainties and matters of significant judgment, therefore cannot be determined with precision. Changes in assumptions could significantly affect the estimates.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	A summary of the Company's risk exposures as they relate to financial instruments are reflected below:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<B>
<I>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA-BOLDOBLIQUE,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	Credit Risk
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	Credit risk is the risk
	of an unexpected loss if a third party to a financial instrument fails to meet
	its contractual obligations. The Company is subject to credit risk on the cash
	balances at the bank, its short-term bank investments and accounts and other
	receivables and the carrying value of those accounts represent the Company's
	maximum exposure to credit risk. The Company's cash and cash equivalents and
	short-term bank investments are with Schedule 1 banks or equivalents. The
	accounts and other receivables consist of GST/HST and VAT receivable from the
	various government agencies and amounts due from related parties. The Company
	has not recorded an impairment or allowance for credit risk as at August 31,
	2013, or August 31, 2012.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<B>
<I>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA-BOLDOBLIQUE,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	Interest Rate Risk
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	Interest rate risk is
	the risk that the fair value or future cash flows of a financial instrument will
	fluctuate because of changes in market interest rate. The Company's bank
	accounts earn interest income at variable rates. The Company's future interest
	income is exposed to changes in short-term rates. As at August 31, 2013, a 1%
	increase/decrease in interest rates would decrease/increase net loss for the
	year by approximately $107,000 (2012 - $200,000).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<B>
<I>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA-BOLDOBLIQUE,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	Liquidity Risk
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	The Company's
	approach to managing liquidity risk is to ensure that it will have sufficient
	liquidity to meet liabilities when due. As at August 31, 2013, the Company had
	current assets of $11,289,745 (August 31, 2012 - $20,483,824) and current
	liabilities of $5,873,641 (August 31, 2012 - $2,318,393), including warrant
	liability or $2,349,641 (August 31, 2012 - $2,318,393) excluding warrant
	liability. All of the Company's trade payables and receivables have
	contractual maturities of less than 90 days and are subject to normal trade
	terms. Current working capital of the Company is $5,416,104 (August 31, 2012 -
	$18,165,431) including warrant liability or a working capital of $8,940,104
	(August 31, 2012 - $18,165,431) excluding warrant liability.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<B>
<I>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA-BOLDOBLIQUE,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	Foreign Currency Risk
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	The Company is exposed
	to the financial risk related to the fluctuation of foreign exchange rates. The
	Company has offices in Canada, USA, and Tanzania, but holds cash mainly in
	Canadian and United States currencies. A significant change in the currency
	exchange rates between the Canadian dollar relative to US dollar and Tanzanian
	shillings could have an effect on the Company's results of operations,
	financial position, or cash flows. At August 31, 2013, the Company had no
	hedging agreements in place with respect to foreign exchange rates. As a
	majority of the funds of the Company are held in Canadian currencies, the
	foreign currency risk associated with US dollar and Tanzanian Shilling financial
	instruments is not considered significant at August 31, 2013.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	41
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>

<TD ALIGN=LEFT>
<B>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA-BOLD,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	14. Prepaid expenses
</FONT>
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN=LEFT STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000;">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN=LEFT STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000;">
	&nbsp;
</TD>

<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	Trade and other payables of the Company are principally comprised of amounts outstanding for trade purchases relating to exploration activities and payroll liabilities. The usual credit period taken for trade purchases is between 30 to 90 days.

	18. Cash and cash equivalents
</FONT>
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN=LEFT>

<TD ALIGN=LEFT>

</TD>

<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	As at August 31, 2013,
	cash and cash equivalents total $10,679,516 (August 31, 2012 - $20,058,678),
	consisting of cash on deposit with banks in general minimum interest bearing
	accounts totalling $329,659 (August 31, 2012 - $2,027,295), and Government
	investment certificates and treasury bills consisting of interest-generating
	money-market accounts of $10,349,857 (August 31, 2012 - $18,031,383). The
	interest-generating government investment certificate is cashable at any time
	and the Company expects to convert this into cash on an as needed basis.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA-BOLD,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	19. Segmented information
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA-BOLD,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	Operating Segments
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	At August 31, 2013 the
	Company's operations comprise a single reporting operating segment engaged in
	mineral exploration in Tanzania. The Company's corporate division only earns
	interest revenue that is considered incidental to the activities of the Company
	and therefore does not meet the definition of an operating segment as defined in
	IFRS 8
</FONT>
<I>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA-OBLIQUE,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	'Operating
	Segments'
</FONT>
</I>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	.
	As the operations comprise a single reporting segment, amounts disclosed in the
	consolidated financial statements also represent operating segment amounts.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	An operating segment is defined as a component of the Company:
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<LI>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	that engages in business activities from which it may earn revenues and incur expenses;
</FONT>
</LI>
<LI>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	whose operating results
	are reviewed regularly by the entity's chief operating decision maker; and
</FONT>
</LI>
<LI>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	for which discrete financial information is available.
</FONT>
</LI>
</UL>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	43
</FONT>
</P>

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	The enacted tax rates in Canada of 26.0% (25.8% - 2012) and Tanzania of 30% (30% - 2012) where the company operates are applied in the tax provision calculation. The combined Canadian federal and provincial statutory rate has increased from the prior period due to a scheduled enacted rate increase.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA-BOLD,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	The following
	table reflects the Company's deferred income tax assets (liabilities):
</FONT>
</B>
</P>

<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA-BOLD,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	23. Subsequent event
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	On October 4, 2010 the
	Company completed a private placement with arm's length third parties
	consisting of three-year convertible promissory notes in the aggregate amount of
	$1,060,000 bearing interest at 3% per annum and convertible into 204,772 common
	shares, if the Holders elected to convert. On September 14, 2013 the promissory
	notes matured and the Holders elected repayment of the promissory notes in cash.
	Accordingly $1,060,000 plus interest in the amount of $30,000 was paid on
	September 16, 2013.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT SIZE=2 FACE="HELVETICA,ARIAL,HELVETICA,SANS-SERIF">
	46
</FONT>
</P>
</EFX_EXHIBIT_15>

<DIV CLASS="eolNewPage"></DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage192"></A>
<A NAME="MDA_HTM"></A>
<EFX_EXHIBIT_15>
<A NAME="FIS_EXHIBIT_15_2"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 12PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0">
<IMG SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2013/11/15/0001137171-13-000367_IMAGE_001.GIF" ALT="TANZ LOGO NR 2" STYLE="HEIGHT: 87PX; WIDTH: 358PX">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 12PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0">
	&nbsp;
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 12PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
<B>
	Management Discussion and Analysis
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 12PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
<B>
	August 31, 2013
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 12PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 2PT SOLID">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The following Management&#8217;s Discussion
	and Analysis (&#8220;MD&amp;A&#8221;) of the financial condition and results of operations for Tanzanian Royalty Exploration Corporation
	(the &#8220;Company&#8221;) should be read in conjunction with the audited consolidated financial statements for the years ended
	August 31, 2013 and 2012. The MD&amp;A was prepared as of November 12, 2013. All amounts are in Canadian dollars, unless otherwise
	specified.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	Highlights &#8211; for the year ended August
	31, 2013
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 12PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT: 10PT SYMBOL">
	&middot;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	The Company&#8217;s Kigosi Project has been
	granted a Mineral Rights and Mining Licence, through its wholly owned subsidiary, Tanzania American International Development Corporation
	2000 Limited (&#8220;Tanzam&#8221;). The Mineral Rights and Mining Licence covers the entire area applied for, 9.91 square kilometres
	of the Kigosi Project. The grant of a Mining Licence allows for eventual production at Kigosi.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 12PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT: 10PT SYMBOL">
	&middot;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	Potential Tungsten occurrences in northwest
	Tanzania from licences held by Northwestern Base Metals Company Limited, a subsidiary of the Company.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 12PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT: 10PT SYMBOL">
	&middot;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	The Company reintroduced the Biogeochemical
	(BGC) program for macro targeting of mineral resources. The BGC objective for the company&#8217;s prospecting licenses in the Karagwe-Akolean
	belt is to conduct an efficient and rapid exploration survey targeting Nickel, Cobalt and the Platinum Group Metals (PGM).
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 12PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT: 10PT SYMBOL">
	&middot;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	Buckreef Gold Project deep diamond drill
	program was completed during the year. Assay results from the deep diamond drill program confirmed continuity of wide, higher grade
	gold mineralization.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 12PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0">

<FONT STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	The Company signed Kigosi Access Agreement
	in December 2012 and in February 2013 the Company was awarded an Environmental Impact Assessment (EIA) Certificate for Kigosi.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

	Assay results from Eastern Porphyry prospect
	at the Buckreef Gold Project continues to increase confidence in the additional potential the prospect might possess
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

	&nbsp;

	The Company is preparing mineral resource
	block models and upgraded mineral resource statements for the Company&#8217;s Buckreef Project
<FONT STYLE="COLOR: BLACK">
	as a
	result of the successful completion of the Company&#8217;s expanded drilling program
</FONT>
</FONT>
</TD>

	&nbsp;
</P>

	In November 2012 the Company announced the
	formation of Northwestern Basemetals Company Limited, a new company 75% owned by Tanzanian Royalty, 15% by State Mining Corporation
	(&#8220;Stamico&#8221;) and 10% by Songshan Mining Company, to explore the Kabanga nickel, cobalt and platinum group metals belt
	in Tanzania
