<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<P STYLE="FONT: 12PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0">
<B>
	&nbsp;
<IMG SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2013/11/15/0001137171-13-000367_IMAGE_001.GIF" ALT="TANZ LOGO NR 2" STYLE="HEIGHT: 87PX; WIDTH: 358PX">
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 12PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
<B>
	Management Discussion and Analysis
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 12PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
<B>
	August 31, 2013
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 12PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 2PT SOLID">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	Overall Performance
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	As at August 31, 2013 the Company had current
	assets of $11,289,745 compared to $20,483,824 on August 31, 2012. The decrease is mainly due to net expenditures on exploration
	of $4,109,573 (2012 - $9,593,993) and cash used in operations of $4,137,953 (2012 - $4,713,619). Mineral properties and deferred
	exploration costs were $45,932,207 as compared to $44,017,541 at August 31, 2012.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Net loss for the year ended August 31, 2013
	was $3,225,998 compared to a net loss of $8,897,843 in the comparable year ended August 31, 2012. The decrease in net loss is primarily
	due to a gain of $4,590,000 from the revaluation of warrant liability during the year ended August 31, 2013 compared to a loss
	of $2,321,921 on the same revaluation of the warrant liability in 2012 offset by an increase in the loss due to share based payments
	of $1,053,509 for the year ended August 31, 2013 (2012 - $777,640) and write down in mineral properties and deferred exploration
	costs of $2,194,907 (2012 - $1,293,969).
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 12PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 66PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The Company issued common shares during the
	year ended August 31, 2013 with a value of $986,334 on conversion of 221,337 shares under the convertible debt agreement (compared
	to a value of $950,213 on conversion of 233,318 shares under the convertible debt agreement during the year ended August 31, 2012).
	The Company also issued 241,308 shares (2012 &#8211; 182,866 shares) pursuant to the RSU plan with a value of $1,151,010 (2012
	- $1,024,793). During the comparative year ended August 31, 2012, 250,000 warrants were exercised for proceeds of $1,000,000 and
	35,000 shares valued at $115,834 were issued for services. No warrants were exercised in the current year ended August 31, 2013.
	In the current year, capital is being utilized for the Buckreef Gold Project development, property acquisition, exploration, capital
	equipment purchases and general operating expenses as tabulated below. The remaining funds/cash liquid assets are invested in interest
	bearing investments, which are highly liquid.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 11PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE">

</TD>

</B>

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Management of the Company believes that the
	current level of funds is sufficient to achieve its business objectives and milestones over the next 12 months. Management continues
	to explore alternative financing sources in the form of equity, debt or a combination thereof; however the current economic uncertainty
	and financial market volatility make it difficult to predict success. Risk factors potentially influencing the Company&#8217;s
	ability to raise equity or debt financing include: the outcome of the feasibility study at the Buckreef Project, mineral prices,
	the risk of operating in a foreign country, including, without limitation, risks relating to permitting, and the buoyancy of the
	credit and equity markets. For a more detailed list of risk factors, refer to the Company&#8217;s Annual Information Form for the
	year ended August 31, 2013, which is filed on SEDAR.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Due to the current low interest rate environment,
	interest income is not expected to be a significant source of income or cash flow. Management intends to monitor spending and assess
	results on an ongoing basis and will make appropriate changes as required.
</P>
<!-- FIELD: PAGE; SEQUENCE: 2 -->

<P STYLE="FONT: 12PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0">
<B>
<IMG SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2013/11/15/0001137171-13-000367_IMAGE_001.GIF" ALT="TANZ LOGO NR 2" STYLE="HEIGHT: 87PX; WIDTH: 358PX">
	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 12PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0">
<B>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 12PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
<B>
	Management Discussion and Analysis
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 12PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
<B>
	August 31, 2013
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 12PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 2PT SOLID">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0">
	TRENDS
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 12PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT: 10PT SYMBOL">
	&middot;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	There are significant uncertainties regarding
	the prices of precious and base metals and other minerals and the availability of equity and debt financing for the purposes of
	mineral exploration and development. The
<FONT STYLE="COLOR: BLACK">
	prices of precious and base metals have been subject to extreme
	volatility over recent periods, as such the Company remains cautious
</FONT>
	;
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 12PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT: 10PT SYMBOL">
	&middot;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	The Company&#8217;s future performance is
	largely tied to the outcome of future drilling results and the development of the Buckreef project; and
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 12PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT: 10PT SYMBOL">
	&middot;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	Current financial markets are likely to be
	volatile in Canada for the remainder of the year, reflecting ongoing concerns about the stability of the global economy. As well,
	concern about global growth may lead to future drops in the commodity markets. Uncertainty in the credit markets has also led to
	increased difficulties in borrowing/raising funds. Companies worldwide have been negatively affected by these trends. As a result,
	the Company may have difficulties raising equity and debt financing for the purposes of base and precious metals exploration and
	development.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	These trends may limit the Company&#8217;s ability
	to discover and develop an economically viable mineral deposit.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_69"></A>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	Selected Financial Information
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" STYLE="FONT: 8PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 44%; BORDER-TOP: WINDOWTEXT 1.5PT SOLID; PADDING-RIGHT: 5.4PT; PADDING-LEFT: 5.4PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 19%; BORDER-TOP: WINDOWTEXT 1.5PT SOLID; BORDER-BOTTOM: WINDOWTEXT 1PT SOLID; PADDING-RIGHT: 5.4PT; PADDING-LEFT: 5.4PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT: 8PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
<B>
	As at and for the year ended August 31, 2013
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	Results of Operations
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 12PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT/NORMAL TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	Net
	additions to mineral properties and deferred exploration costs for the year ended August 31, 2013 were $4,109,573 compared to $9,593,993
	for the year ended August 31, 2012. The amount has decreased as compared with prior year as the Company advances its exploration
	of the Buckreef project and other projects in its portfolio and at the same time is conscious about conserving its cash in the
	current economic downturn.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIALMT,SANS-SERIF">
	Recoveries received during the year ended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	August
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIALMT,SANS-SERIF">
	31, 2013 and 2012 from various option agreements and other miscellaneous sources
	were $41,786 and $50,114, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIALMT,SANS-SERIF">
	Net
	loss for the year ended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	August
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIALMT,SANS-SERIF">
	31,
	2013 was $3,225,998 compared to a loss of $8,897,843 for the comparable year ended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	August
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIALMT,SANS-SERIF">
	31, 2012
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL-BOLDMT,SANS-SERIF">
<B>
	.
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIALMT,SANS-SERIF">
	For
	the three month period ended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	August
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIALMT,SANS-SERIF">
	31,
	2013 and 2012, the net loss was $2,754,677 and $3,576,139, respectively. The main reason for the decrease in net loss for the year
	ended August 31, 2013 is the gain on revaluation of warrant liability of $4,590,000 (2012 &#8211; loss of $2,321,921) offset by
	a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	write down in mineral properties and deferred exploration costs
	of $2,194,907 (2012 - $1,293,969).
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIALMT,SANS-SERIF">
	For the three month period ended August
	31, 2013, net loss also decreased
	mainly due to the revaluation of warrant liability resulting in a loss of $747,000 (2012 &#8211; loss of $1,927,000) offset by
	a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	write down in mineral properties and deferred exploration costs
	of $695,094 (2012 - $((66,601)).
</FONT>
</P>

	the year ended

</FONT>

	31,

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	August
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIALMT,SANS-SERIF">
	31, 2012. The decrease of $91,084 was due to the lower capital asset cost base as purchases in the period were minimal and depreciation
	lowered the capital asset balance. The capital expenditure for the year ended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	August

	decrease is mainly due to the company closely managing its office and general costs including closure of the Mwanza office and
	consolidation of offices at the Buckreef camp, as well as reduced freight expenses.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIALMT,SANS-SERIF">

	the three month period ended

	31,

	August
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIALMT,SANS-SERIF">
	31, 2012. The decrease for the three month period is due to the same reason

	due
	to decreased activity during the

	year ended

	August
<FONT STYLE="COLOR: BLACK; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
	31, 2013 in comparison to 2012 due to transfer agent and listing fees from
	the issue of shares for converted debt and corporate investor promotion activity completed during the prior year ended 2012.
</FONT>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIALMT,SANS-SERIF">
	For
	the three month period ended
</FONT>

	August
</FONT>

	31,

	August
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIALMT,SANS-SERIF">
	31, 2012. The negative amount in fiscal 2012 was due to account reclassifications
	in the period.

</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT/NORMAL ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT/NORMAL TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIALMT,SANS-SERIF">
	Professional
	fees decreased by $136,749 for the year ended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	August
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIALMT,SANS-SERIF">
	31,
	2013 to $732,328 from $869,077 for the year ended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	August
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIALMT,SANS-SERIF">
	31,
	2012. Professional fees decreased between the comparable periods as the Company incurred one time costs during fiscal 2012 related
	to the transition to IFRS and various legal work related to its Buckreef property. For the three month period ended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	August
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIALMT,SANS-SERIF">
	31, 2013 professional fees went from $464,054 for the three month period ended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	August
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIALMT,SANS-SERIF">
	31,
	2012 to $318,594 for the three month period ended August 31, 2013. The decrease in the current three month period is due to the
	same reason as above.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT/NORMAL ARIALMT,SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; COLOR: RED">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT/NORMAL TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	Salaries
	and benefits expense has decreased to $1,388,160 for the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIALMT,SANS-SERIF">
	year ended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	August
	31, 2013 from $1,596,951 for the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIALMT,SANS-SERIF">
	year ended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	August
	31, 2012. The
<FONT STYLE="COLOR: BLACK">
	decrease is due to a reduced workforce on staff in&nbsp;Tanzania during the current year
	and termination payments in the prior year.
</FONT>
	The expenses for the corresponding
	three month period ending August 31, 2013 and 2012 were $261,860 and $502,877 respectively.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIALMT,SANS-SERIF">
	The
	decrease in the current three month period is due to the same reason as above.
</FONT>
</FONT>
</P>

	Management Discussion and Analysis
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 12PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
<B>
	August 31, 2013
</B>

<P STYLE="FONT: 12PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 2PT SOLID">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT/NORMAL TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT/NORMAL TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	Share
	based payments for the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIALMT,SANS-SERIF">
	year ended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	August
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIALMT,SANS-SERIF">
	31, 2013
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	were
	$1,053,509 compared to $777,630 in the comparable year
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIALMT,SANS-SERIF">
	ended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	August
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIALMT,SANS-SERIF">
	31, 2012
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	. Share
	based payments vary depending on the number of equity based compensation options issued and vesting. See note 8 of the financial
	statements for details.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIALMT,SANS-SERIF">
	Director fee RSU expense was $208,572 and $289,448,
	respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT/NORMAL ARIALMT,SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT/NORMAL TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIALMT,SANS-SERIF">
	For
	the year ended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	August
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIALMT,SANS-SERIF">
	31,
	2013, travel and accommodation expense decreased by $43,058 from $169,420 in 2012 to $126,362. For the three months ended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	August
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIALMT,SANS-SERIF">
	31, 2013, travel and accommodation expense increased by $3,107 from $35,349
	in 2012 to $38,456. Travel and accommodation expense decreased due to timing and increased control of travel requirements, while
	remaining consistent in the last quarter of 2013.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT/NORMAL ARIALMT,SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; COLOR: RED">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT/NORMAL TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIALMT,SANS-SERIF">
	For
	the year ended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	August
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIALMT,SANS-SERIF">
	31,
	2013, the foreign exchange loss was $5,215 compared to an exchange gain of $24,082 for the same year ended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	August
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIALMT,SANS-SERIF">
	31, 2012. This increased loss of $29,297 was due to the years&#8217; average
	Tanzanian Shilling exchange rate having increased from 1,572 at
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	August
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIALMT,SANS-SERIF">
	31, 2012 to 1,524 at
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	August
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIALMT,SANS-SERIF">
	31, 2013.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT/NORMAL ARIALMT,SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIALMT,SANS-SERIF">
	The
	interest accretion expense for the year ended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	August
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIALMT,SANS-SERIF">
	31,
	2013 was $55,549, compared to $102,785 for the year ended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	August
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIALMT,SANS-SERIF">
	31, 2012. The interest relates to the issuance of convertible debt.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	Interest
	accretion is expected to decrease as debt is converted into shares or repaid. Interest income
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIALMT,SANS-SERIF">
	for
	the year ended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	August
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIALMT,SANS-SERIF">
	31,
	2013 was $133,116, compared to $274,913 for the year ended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	August
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIALMT,SANS-SERIF">
	31, 2012. Interest income has decreased as the average cash balance in interest
	bearing accounts decreased during the current year.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	During
	the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIALMT,SANS-SERIF">
	year ended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	August
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIALMT,SANS-SERIF">
	31, 2013
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	, the
	Company agreed to abandon and wrote off $2,194,907 in expenses in various project areas (2012 &#8211; wrote off $1,293,969) from
	abandoning various licenses, see note 4 of the financial statements, as the Company evaluated its mineral properties and has no
	current plans to explore, but may in the future.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	A gain of $4,590,000 (2012 &#8211; loss of $2,321,921)
	was recognized during the year ended August 31, 2013 in connection with the revaluation of the warrant liability.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;

	$(0.01)

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<IMG SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2013/11/15/0001137171-13-000367_IMAGE_001.GIF" ALT="TANZ LOGO NR 2" STYLE="HEIGHT: 87PX; WIDTH: 358PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
<P STYLE="FONT: 12PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0">
<B>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 12PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
<B>
	Management Discussion and Analysis
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 12PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
<B>
	August 31, 2013
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 12PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 2PT SOLID">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
<U>
	Liquidity and Capital Resources
</U>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The Company manages liquidity risk by maintaining
	adequate cash balances in order to meet short term business requirements. Because the Company does not currently derive any production
	revenue from operations, its ability to conduct exploration and development work on its properties is largely based upon its ability
	to raise capital by equity funding. Previously, the Company has obtained funding via private placements, public offering and various
	sources, including the Company&#8217;s President and CEO.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	As of August 31, 2013, the Company&#8217;s working
	capital position was $5,416,104 (August 31, 2012 &#8211; $18,165,431), including warrant liability or a working capital of $8,940,104
	(August 31, 2012 &#8211; $18,165,431) excluding warrant liability. As the Company&#8217;s mineral properties advance, additional
	equity and debt financing will be required to fund exploration and mining activities.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The Company has prepared a cash flow forecast
	for fiscal 2014 and believes that it has sufficient funds to continue operations for at least the next twelve months.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Some of the Company&#8217;s mineral properties
	are being acquired over time by way of option payments. It is at the Company&#8217;s option as to whether to continue with the
	acquisition of the mineral properties and to incur these option payments.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The Company has no contractual obligations as
	of the latest fiscal year end.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	Convertible Debt
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT/115% ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Pursuant to the private placement completed
	on September 23, 2010, the Company received notice from an arm&#8217;s length third party to convert its Promissory Note in the
	principal amount of $1,000,000 bearing interest at 3% and convertible into 221,337 common shares at a price of $4.518 per share,
	and 221,337 shares were issued on October 17, 2012.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT/115% ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT/115% ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	On October 4, 2010 the Company completed
	a private placement with arm&#8217;s length third parties consisting of three-year convertible promissory notes in the aggregate
	principal amount of $1,060,000 bearing interest at 3% and convertible into 204,772 common shares at the price of $5.1765 per share.
	On September 14, 2013 the promissory notes matured and the Holders elected repayment of the promissory notes in cash.&nbsp; Accordingly
	$1,060,000 plus interest in the amount of $30,000 was paid on September 16, 2013.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	Off-Balance Sheet Arrangements
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The Company has no off-balance sheet arrangements.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	Transactions with Related Parties
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT/115% ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT/115% ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Related parties include the Board
	of Directors and officers, close family members and enterprises that are controlled by these individuals as well as certain consultants
	performing similar functions.
</P>
<!-- FIELD: PAGE; SEQUENCE: 6 -->
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1PT SOLID">

<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM; BORDER-BOTTOM: WINDOWTEXT 1PT SOLID; PADDING-RIGHT: 5.4PT; PADDING-LEFT: 5.4PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; LINE-HEIGHT: 115%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT: 10PT/115% ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">

	$23,750
</B>
</FONT>

<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; BORDER-BOTTOM: WINDOWTEXT 1PT SOLID; PADDING-RIGHT: 5.4PT; PADDING-LEFT: 5.4PT; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; LINE-HEIGHT: 115%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">

	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT/115% ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	(i) The Company engages a legal firm for
	professional services in which one of the Company&#8217;s directors is a partner. During the year ended August 31, 2013, the legal
	expense charged by the firm was $269,880 (2012 - $553,949), of which $13,143 remains payable at August 31, 2013 (2012 - $140,245).

	rental.

	&nbsp;

<P STYLE="FONT: BOLD 4PT/0.7PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-INDENT: 34PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT/115% ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 13.5PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT: NORMAL 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	(1)
</FONT>
	Salaries and benefits include director fees. The board of directors do not have employment or service contracts with the
	Company. Directors are entitled to director fees and RSU&#8217;s for their services and officers are entitled to cash remuneration
	and RSU&#8217;s for their services.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT/115% ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 14.2PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: -14.2PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT: NORMAL 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(2)
	Compensation shares may carry restrictive legends.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT/115% ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 14.2PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: -14.2PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT: NORMAL 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(3)
	All RSU share based compensation is based on the accounting expense recorded in the year.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT/115% ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 13.5PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	Restricted Stock Unit Plan
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The Restricted Stock Unit Plan (&#8220;RSU Plan&#8221;)
	is intended to enhance the Company&#8217;s and its affiliates&#8217; abilities to attract and retain highly qualified officers,
	directors, key employees and other persons, and to motivate such officers, directors, key employees and other persons to serve
	the Company and its affiliates and to expend maximum effort to improve the business results and earnings of the Company, by providing
	to such persons an opportunity to acquire or increase a direct proprietary interest in the operations and future success of the
	Company. To this end, the RSU Plan provides for the grant of restricted stock units (&#8220;RSUs&#8221;). Each RSU represents an
	entitlement to one common share of the Company, upon vesting. As of November 9, 2012 the Board resolved to suspend 1,500,000 of
	the 2,500,000 common shares previously authorized for issuance under the RSU Plan, such that a maximum of 1,000,000 shares shall
	be authorized for issuance under the RSU Plan, until such suspension may be lifted or further amended. Any of these awards of RSUs
	may, but need not, be made as performance incentives to reward attainment of annual or long-term performance goals in accordance
	with the terms of the RSU Plan. Any such performance goals are specified in the Award Agreement.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Of the 1,000,000 shares authorized for issuance
	under the Plan, 873,361 shares have been issued as at August 31, 2013.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	Critical Accounting Estimates
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT/12.65PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 12.4PT 0 0">
<FONT STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: -0.2PT">
<B>
	Assessment
	of Recoverability of Mineral Property Costs
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT/12.65PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0.35PT 0 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The deferred cost of mineral
	properties and their related development costs are deferred until the properties are placed into production, sold or abandoned.
	These costs will be amortized over the estimated useful life of the properties following the commencement of production. Cost includes
	both the cash consideration as well as the fair market value of any securities issued on the acquisition of mineral properties. Properties acquired
	under option agreements or joint ventures, whereby payments are made at the sole discretion of the Company, are recorded in the
	accounts at such time as the payments are made. The proceeds from property options granted reduce the cost of the related property
	and any excess over cost is applied to income
<FONT STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: -0.05PT">
	The Company&#8217;s recorded value of its exploration
	properties is based on historical costs that expect to be
</FONT>
	recovered in the future. The Company&#8217;s recoverability evaluation
	is based on market conditions for
<FONT STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: -0.15PT">
	minerals, underlying mineral resources associated with
	the properties and future costs that may be required for ultimate realization through mining operations or by sale.
</FONT>
</P>
<!-- FIELD: PAGE; SEQUENCE: 8 -->

	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 12PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 12PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
<B>
	Management Discussion and Analysis
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 12PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
<B>
	August 31, 2013
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 12PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 2PT SOLID">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT/12.65PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0.35PT 0 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT/12.65PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 12.35PT 0 0">
<FONT STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: -0.2PT">
<B>
	Assessment
	of Recoverability of Deferred Income Tax Assets
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT/115% ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	TREC follows the balance sheet method
	of accounting for income taxes. Under this method, deferred tax liabilities and assets are recognized for the estimated tax consequences
	attributable to differences between the financial statement carrying amounts of assets and liabilities and their respective tax
	bases. Deferred tax liabilities and assets are measured using substantively enacted tax rates. The effect on the deferred tax liabilities
	and assets of a change in tax rates is recognized in the period that the change occurs. Deferred income tax assets are recognized
	for all deductible temporary differences, carry forward of unused tax credits and unused tax losses, to the extent that is probable
	that taxable profit will be available against which the deductible temporary difference and the carry forward of unused credits
	and unused tax losses can be utilized.
<FONT STYLE="COLOR: BLACK">
	In preparing the consolidated financial statements, the Company
	is required to estimate its income tax
<FONT STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: -0.05PT">
	obligations. This process involves estimating the
	actual tax exposure together with assessing temporary
</FONT>
	differences resulting from differing treatment of items for tax and
	accounting purposes. The Company
<FONT STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: -0.15PT">
	assesses, based on all available evidence, the likelihood
	that the deferred income tax assets will be recovered from future taxable income and, to the extent that recovery cannot be considered
	probable, the deferred tax asset is not recognized
</FONT>
	.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT/12.65PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 12.35PT 0 0">
<FONT STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: -0.2PT">
<B>
	Estimate
	of Share Based Payments and Warrant Liability and Associated Assumptions
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT/12.65PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0.35PT 0 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: -0.15PT">
	The
	Company recorded share based payments based on an estimate of the fair value on the grant date
</FONT>
	of share based payments issued
	and reviews its foreign currency denominated warrants each period based on their fair value. The accounting required for the warrant
	liability requires estimates of interest rate, life of the warrant, stock price
<FONT STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: -0.1PT">
	volatility
	and the application of the Black-Scholes option pricing model. See note 8 of the August 31,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: -0.15PT">
	2013,
	audited consolidated financial statements for a full disclosure.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT/115% ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 10PT">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT/115% ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 10PT">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT/115% ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 10PT">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT/115% ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 10PT">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT/115% ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 10PT">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT/115% ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 10PT">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT/115% ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 10PT">
<IMG SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2013/11/15/0001137171-13-000367_IMAGE_001.GIF" ALT="TANZ LOGO NR 2" STYLE="HEIGHT: 87PX; WIDTH: 358PX">
<P STYLE="FONT: 12PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0">
<B>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 12PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
<B>
	Management Discussion and Analysis
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 12PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
<B>
	August 31, 2013
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 12PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 2PT SOLID">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT/115% ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 10PT">
<B>
	Critical accounting policies
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT/115% ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 10PT">
<B>
	Mineral Properties
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 8PT 0 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	All direct costs related to the acquisition
	and exploration and development of specific properties are capitalized as incurred. If a property is brought into production, these
	costs will be amortized against the income generated from the property. If a property is abandoned, sold or impaired, an appropriate
	charge will be made to the statement of comprehensive loss at the date of such impairment. Discretionary option payments arising
	on the acquisition of mining properties are only recognized when paid. Amounts received from other parties to earn an interest
	in the Company's mining properties are applied as a reduction of the mining property and deferred exploration and development costs
	until all capitalized costs are recovered at which time additional reimbursements are recorded in the statement of comprehensive
	loss, except for administrative reimbursements which are credited to operations.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 8PT 0 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Consequential revenue from the sale of
	metals, extracted during the Company's test mining activities, is recognized on the date the mineral concentrate level is agreed
	upon by the Company and customer, as this coincides with the transfer of title, the risk of ownership, the determination of the
	amount due under the terms of settlement contracts the Company has with its customer, and collection is reasonably assured. Revenues
	from properties earned prior to the commercial production stage are deducted from capitalized costs.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 8PT 0 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The amounts shown for mining claims and
	related deferred costs represent costs incurred to date, less amounts expensed or written off, reimbursements and revenue, and
	do not necessarily reflect present or future values of the particular properties. The recoverability of these costs is dependent
	upon discovery of economically recoverable reserves and future production or proceeds from the disposition thereof.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 8PT 0 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The Company reviews the carrying value
	of a mineral exploration property when events or changes in circumstances indicate that the carrying value may not be recoverable.
	If the carrying value of the property exceeds its fair value, the property will be written down to fair value with the provision
	charged against operations in the year of impairment. An impairment is also recorded when management determines that it will discontinue
	exploration or development on a property or when exploration rights or permits expire.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 11.5PT 0 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Ownership in mineral properties involves
	certain risks due to the difficulties in determining the validity of certain claims as well as the potential for problems arising
	from the frequently ambiguous conveyance history characteristic of many mineral interests. The Company has investigated the ownership
	of its mineral properties and, to the best of its knowledge, ownership of its interests are in good standing.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 8PT 0 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Capitalized mineral property exploration
	costs are those directly attributable costs related to the search for, and evaluation of mineral resources that are incurred after
	the Company has obtained legal rights to explore a mineral property and before the technical feasibility and commercial viability
	of a mineral reserve are demonstrable. Any cost incurred prior to obtaining the legal right to explore a mineral property are expensed
	as incurred. Field overhead costs directly related to exploration are capitalized and allocated to mineral properties explored.
	All other overhead and administration costs are expensed as incurred.
</P>
<!-- FIELD: PAGE; SEQUENCE: 10 -->
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1PT SOLID">

<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: ALWAYS; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT">
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<TR>

	&nbsp;

<!-- FIELD: /PAGE -->
<P STYLE="FONT: 12PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0">
<IMG SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2013/11/15/0001137171-13-000367_IMAGE_001.GIF" ALT="TANZ LOGO NR 2" STYLE="HEIGHT: 87PX; WIDTH: 358PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 12PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0">
<B>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 12PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
<B>
	Management Discussion and Analysis
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 12PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
<B>
	August 31, 2013
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 12PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 2PT SOLID">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 8PT 0 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Once an economically viable reserve has
	been determined for a property and a decision has been made to proceed with development has been approved, acquisition, exploration
	and development costs previously capitalized to the mineral property are first tested for impairment and then classified as property,
	plant and equipment under construction.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT/115% ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT/115% ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0">
<B>
	Impairment of Long-lived Assets
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT/115% TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	At
	each date of the statement of financial position, the Company reviews the carrying amounts of its tangible and intangible
	assets to determine whether there is an indication that those assets have suffered an impairment loss. If any such indication
	exists, the recoverable amount of the asset is estimated in order to determine the extent of the impairment loss (if any).
	Where it is not possible to estimate the recoverable amount of an individual asset, the Company estimates the recoverable
	amount of the cash
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	generating
	unit to which the assets belong.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT/115% TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	Recoverable
	amount is the higher of fair value less costs to sell and value in use. In assessing value in use, the estimated future cash flows
	are discounted to their present value using a pre
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	tax
	discount rate that reflects current market assessments of the time value of money and the risks specific to the asset.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT/115% TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	If
	the recoverable amount of an asset (or cash
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	generating
	unit) is estimated to be less than its carrying amount, the carrying amount of the asset (or cash
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	generating
	unit) is reduced to its recoverable amount. An impairment loss is recognized immediately in the statement of comprehensive loss.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT/115% TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	Where
	an impairment loss subsequently reverses, the carrying amount of the asset (cash-generating unit) is increased to the revised estimate
	of its recoverable amount, but so that the increased carrying amount does not exceed the carrying amount that would have been determined
	had no impairment loss been recognized for the asset (or cash
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	generating
	unit) in prior years.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The Company&#8217;s most critical accounting
	estimate relates to the impairment of mineral properties and deferred exploration costs. During the year ended
<FONT STYLE="COLOR: BLACK; LETTER-SPACING: -0.1PT">
	August
</FONT>
	31, 2013 the Company wrote off $2,194,907 of costs on abandoned mineral properties (2012 &#8211; $1,293,969). Management
	assesses impairment of its exploration prospects quarterly. If an impairment results, the capitalized costs associated with the
	related project or area of interest are charged to expense.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT/115% ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT/115% ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	Asset Retirement Obligations
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT/115% TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	The
	Company recognizes liabilities for statutory, contractual, constructive or legal obligations, including those associated with the
	reclamation of mineral properties and PPE, when those obligations result from the acquisition, construction, development or normal
	operation of the assets. Initially, a liability for an asset retirement obligation is recognized at its fair value in the period
	in which it is incurred. Upon initial recognition of the liability, the corresponding asset retirement obligation is added to the
	carrying amount of the related asset and the cost is amortized as an expense over the economic life of the asset using either the
	unit
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: CAMBRIA,SERIF">
	&#8208;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: CAMBRIA,SERIF">
	&#8208;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	production
	method or the straight
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: CAMBRIA,SERIF">
	&#8208;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	line
	method, as appropriate. Following the initial recognition of the asset retirement obligation, the carrying amount of the liability
	is increased for the passage of time and adjusted for changes to the current market
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: CAMBRIA,SERIF">
	&#8208;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	based
	discount rate, amount or timing of the underlying cash flows needed
	to settle the obligation. As of
<FONT STYLE="COLOR: BLACK; LETTER-SPACING: -0.1PT">
	August
</FONT>
	31, 2013 no liability for restoration
	exists.
</FONT>
</P>
<!-- FIELD: PAGE; SEQUENCE: 11 -->

<P STYLE="FONT: 12PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0">
<B>
</B>
<IMG SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2013/11/15/0001137171-13-000367_IMAGE_001.GIF" ALT="TANZ LOGO NR 2" STYLE="HEIGHT: 87PX; WIDTH: 358PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 12PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 12PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
<B>
	Management Discussion and Analysis
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 12PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
<B>
	August 31, 2013
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 12PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 2PT SOLID">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT/115% ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 11PT/11.5PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	Financial Instruments
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT/11.5PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 7.9PT 0 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
<I>
	Fair Value of Financial
	Instruments
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT/115% ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The Company designed its other financial
	assets and warrant liability as FVTPL, which are measured at fair value. Fair value of other financial assets is determined based
	on quoted market prices and is categorized as Level 1 measurement. The warrant liability is recorded at fair value based on observable
	market inputs. Other receivables and cash and cash equivalents are classified as loans and receivables, which are measured at amortized
	cost. Trade and other payables and convertible debt are classified as other financial liabilities, which are measured at amortized
	cost. Fair value of Trade and other payables and convertible debt are determined from transaction values that are not based on
	observable market data.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT/115% ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The carrying value of the Company&#8217;s
	cash and cash equivalents, trade and other receivables, trade and other payables approximate their fair value due to the relatively
	short term nature of these instruments.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT/115% ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The Company&#8217;s convertible
	debt fair value is based on market interest rate. As at
<FONT STYLE="COLOR: BLACK; LETTER-SPACING: -0.1PT">
	August
</FONT>
	31, 2013
	the fair value of the convertible debt agreements did not differ materially from their carrying value.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT/115% ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 7.9PT 0 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Fair value estimates are made
	at a specific point in time, based on relevant market information and information about financial instruments. These estimates
	are subject to and involve uncertainties and matters of significant judgment, therefore cannot be determined with precision. Changes
	in assumptions could significantly affect the estimates.
<B>
	&#9;
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT/115% ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	A summary of the Company's risk
	exposures as they relate to financial instruments are reflected below:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT/115% ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
<I>
	Credit Risk
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT/115% ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Credit risk is the risk of an unexpected
	loss if a third party to a financial instrument fails to meet its contractual obligations. The Company is subject to credit risk
	on the cash balances at the bank, its short-term bank investments and accounts and other receivables. The Company&#8217;s cash
	and cash equivalents and short-term bank investments are with Schedule 1 banks or equivalents. The accounts and other receivables
	consist of GST/HST receivable from the Canada Revenue Agency, Tanzanian Revenue Agency and amounts due from related parties.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT/115% ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
<I>
	Interest Rate Risk
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT/115% ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Interest rate risk is the risk that
	the fair value or future cash flows of a financial instrument will fluctuate because of changes in market interest rate. The Company&#8217;s
	bank accounts earn interest income at variable rates. The Company&#8217;s future interest income is exposed to changes in short-term
	rates. As at August 31, 2013, a 1% increase/decrease
	in interest rates would decrease/increase net loss for the year by approximately $107,000 (2012 - $200,000).
</P>
<!-- FIELD: PAGE; SEQUENCE: 12 -->

<P STYLE="FONT: 12PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0">
<B>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 12PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
<B>
	Management Discussion and Analysis
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 12PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
<B>
	August 31, 2013
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 12PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 2PT SOLID">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT/115% ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT/115% ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
<I>
	Liquidity Risk
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT/115% ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The Company&#8217;s approach to
	managing liquidity risk is to ensure that it will have sufficient liquidity to meet liabilities when due. As at August 31, 2013,
	the Company had current assets of $11,289,745 (August 31, 2012 - $20,483,824) and current liabilities of $5,873,641 (August 31,
	2012 - $2,318,393), including warrant liability or $2,349,641 (August 31, 2012 &#8211; $2,318,393) excluding warrant liability.
	All of the Company&#8217;s trade payables and receivables have contractual maturities of less than 90 days and are subject to normal
	trade terms. Current working capital of the Company is $5,416,104 (August 31, 2012 - $18,165,431) including warrant liability or
	a working capital of $8,940,104 (August 31, 2012 &#8211; $18,165,431) excluding warrant liability.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT/115% ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
<I>
	Foreign Currency Risk
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT/11.5PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 7.9PT 0 12PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The Company is exposed to
	the financial risk related to the fluctuation of foreign exchange rates. The Company has offices in Canada, USA, and Tanzania,
	but holds cash mainly in Canadian and United States currencies. A significant change in the currency exchange rates between the
	Canadian dollar relative to US dollar and Tanzanian shillings could have an effect on the Company&#8217;s results of operations,
	financial position, or cash flows. At August 31, 2013, the Company had no hedging agreements in place with respect to foreign exchange
	rates. As a majority of the funds of the Company are held in Canadian currencies, the foreign currency risk associated with US
	dollar and Tanzanian Shilling financial instruments is not considered significant at August 31, 2013.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	Disclosure of Outstanding Share Data
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	As at the date of this MD&amp;A, there were
	&#9;100,922,582 common shares outstanding. There were RSUs and warrants outstanding to purchase an aggregate 6,003,157 common shares.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	Subsequent Event
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT/115% ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
	On October
	4, 2010 the Company completed a private placement with arm&#8217;s length third parties consisting of three-year convertible promissory
	notes in the aggregate amount of $1,060,000 bearing interest at 3% per annum and convertible into 204,772 common shares, if the
	Holders elected to convert.&nbsp; On September 14, 2013 the promissory notes matured and the Holders elected repayment of the promissory
	notes in cash.&nbsp; Accordingly $1,060,000 plus interest in the amount of $30,000 was paid on September 16, 2013.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">

	The Company in the ordinary course of business
	has been notified of a claim&nbsp;for additional compensation by a contractor and believes that the ultimate outcome of this action
	will not have a material adverse effect on its operation results, liquidity or financial position.&nbsp;
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<P STYLE="FONT: 12PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0">
<B>
</B>
<IMG SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2013/11/15/0001137171-13-000367_IMAGE_001.GIF" ALT="TANZ LOGO NR 2" STYLE="HEIGHT: 87PX; WIDTH: 358PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 12PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 12PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
<B>
	Management Discussion and Analysis
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 12PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
<B>
	August 31, 2013
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 12PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 2PT SOLID">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	Outlook
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT/NORMAL ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
	The
	Company&#8217;s Board of Directors has confirmed the strategic objective of the Corporation is to explore and evaluate its various
	mineral properties and develop the Buckreef Gold Mine Re-development Project and the Kigosi project in northern Tanzania. In addition,
	management is of the opinion that the Golden Horseshoe Reef (GHR) at Itetemia represents a modest, yet robust, medium-grade, near
	surface gold deposit that warrants further feasibility investigations.
</FONT>
	Management of the Company has developed a conceptual
	production plan. This plan is based on advancing Buckreef (including Bingwa and Tembo), Itetemia and Kigosi projects through various
	stages of development to production.
<FONT STYLE="BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
	The Company seeks out and explores gold, nickel and
	other mineral deposits with the intention of developing certain ones for our own account and partnering with an exploration corporation
	to generate royalty interest in a deposit that results in production.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT/NORMAL ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 10PT">
<B>
	Exploration Summary
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT/115% ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	Buckreef Project
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT/115% ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	A total of 3 PQ size holes were
	completed at Bingwa prospect for 209m to enable the collection of at least 400kg samples of Oxide ore material, Transition ore
	material and sulphide ore material for column Heap Leach amenability testwork on the coarse size ore fraction.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT/NORMAL ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	Resource Developments
</B>
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 12PT/150% TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT: 10PT WINGDINGS">
	&sect;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; COLOR: BLACK">
	Company management awarded
	an independent mineral consultant group a contract to undertake the Buckreef Mineral Resource estimate and to produce a NI 43-101
	compliant technical report.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 12PT/150% TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT: 10PT WINGDINGS">
	&sect;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	Site visit completed by independent consultants,
	to examine styles of mineralization, verify data and gather Information for compilation into NI 43-101 report report and completion
	of resource modeling wireframes.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT/115% ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT/115% ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	Geological interpretation and
	data validation
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT/115% ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	All the geological information including
	geological interpretation on the Buckreef Project required for the compilation into NI43-101 technical report was provided to independent
	consultants and database collected from the Company is being reviewed and validated.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT/115% ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	Resource Modeling Progress
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT/115% ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Database reconstructed for modelling
	using consistent codes have been completed, collar elevations fixed to fit surveyed topography at Buckreef, wireframes have been
	modeled for all zones, and rules have been applied so that the wireframes have been constructed in a consistent manner and honor
	the data.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT/115% ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<!-- FIELD: PAGE; SEQUENCE: 14 -->
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1PT SOLID">

<TR>

	&nbsp;

<A NAME="eolPage206"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: ALWAYS; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT">
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; WIDTH: 33%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; WIDTH: 34%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; WIDTH: 33%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<!-- FIELD: /PAGE -->
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT/115% ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<IMG SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2013/11/15/0001137171-13-000367_IMAGE_001.GIF" ALT="TANZ LOGO NR 2" STYLE="HEIGHT: 87PX; WIDTH: 358PX">
<P STYLE="FONT: 12PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0">
<B>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 12PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
<B>
	Management Discussion and Analysis
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 12PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
<B>
	August 31, 2013
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 12PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 2PT SOLID">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT/115% ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT/115% ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	Resource Wireframing Progress
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT/115% ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Tembo prospect has been modeled
	using single zone with 0.1g/t gold grade shell, Eastern Porphyry prospect modeled into geological domains by three porphyry units
	enclosed within mafic unit either side, Bingwa deposit modeled in five discrete zones with 0.18g/t gold grade shells and Buckreef
	main mineralized wireframe constructed using 0.15g/t gold grade shells and oxide, transition and topographic surfaces were modeled
	using gridding algorithm.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0">
<B>
	Mineral Resource Estimation
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0">
	Buckreef Project Mineral Resource Upgrade by independent consultants
	for the&nbsp;Buckreef, Tembo, Bingwa and Eastern Porphyry prospects&nbsp;progressed well during the period.&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT/115% ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT/115% ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	Project Development
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT/115% ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Management of the Company is considering
	whether to adopt a coarse fraction column Heap Leach (HL) process option on the Buckreef mining plan as a suitable option compared
	to the conventional CIL process. The HL process bears the lowest processing costs and has reasonable gold recoveries.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT/115% ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Metallurgical testwork to date has
	focused on suitability for conventional CIL processing of the ore material. However a Phase 2 metallurgical testwork report identified
	relatively good results for coarse ore leaching. Recoveries of between 52% and 81% for Buckreef ore were achieved. This was considered
	by the consultants to be a reasonable recovery for Heap Leach, and it was suggested that further investigations into the viability
	of this process be carried out.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT/115% ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	Heap Leach Sampling and testwork
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT/115% ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	A total of 592.5kg sample material
	representing Oxide ore (261kg), transition ore (149.5kg) and sulphide ore (182kg) were collected from drill holes BGDD015, BGDD016
	and BGDD017. The samples were packed at site and submitted to an independent metallurgical laboratory in South Africa for required
	testing.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT/115% ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	Scope of work and testwork required
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT/115% ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Two scenarios were established to
	carry out the testwork as per the total mass required to complete the scope of work.
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 12PT/115% TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT: 10PT SYMBOL">
	&middot;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	Scenario 1
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 12PT/115% TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT">

</TD>

</FONT>

	Head assay 0.5kg
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 12PT/115% TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT">

	&Oslash;
</FONT>
</TD>

	Simulated heap leach on 4 crushed size 20kg
</FONT>

</TR>

<FONT STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	Total weight required 196.5kg per each ore
	materials
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT/115% ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Scenario 2 was recommended as the
	total weight for all ore material submitted is 592.5kg and the required weight for that scenario to complete the testwork is 196.5kg
	* 3 = 589.5kg.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT/115% ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	Karagwe BGC Survey
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT/115% ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	During the report period, Kabanga
	nickel biogeochemical (BGC) field sampling activities continued with a total of 4,208 samples BGC samples and 365 soil samples
	collected on two prospecting licences.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT/115% ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The fourth quarter period also saw
	the progress of BGC sample preparation laboratory at the Buckreef camp. A total of 1578 samples were prepared by drying at 70 degrees
	celsius for 12 hours, sieved and ground ready for dispatch to the laboratory. 893 samples were packed, inspected by officials from
	the Ministry of Energy &amp; Minerals (MEM) and Tanzania Revenue Authority (TRA) before an export permit was issued. The 893 samples
	were then shipped to Acme Analytical Laboratories (&#8220;Acme&#8221;) in Vancouver, Canada for analysis for multi-element analysis
	using Coupled Plasma Mass Spectrometry (ICP-MS) to detect 53 elements suite within the collected tissue samples after proper laboratory
	preparation by controlled ashing and then placing the sample material on an aqua regia digestion.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT/115% ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	During the reporting period, a total
	of 893 analytical results were received from Acme in the case of BGC samples that led to a thorough analysis of the BGC data for
	that property.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT/115% ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 10PT 0.25IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	Itetemia
</B>
</P>
<!-- FIELD: PAGE; SEQUENCE: 16 -->
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1PT SOLID">

<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: ALWAYS; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT">
